description: Google Super App combines all Google services including Drive, Calendar, Gmail, Sheets, Analytics, Ads, and more, providing a unified platform for seamless integration and management of your digital life.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_ACL_PATCH
tools.description: Updates an access control rule for a calendar using patch semantics (partial update). This allows modifying specific fields without affecting other properties. Note: Each patch request consumes three quota units. For domain-type ACL rules, if PATCH fails with 500 error, this action will automatically fallback to UPDATE method.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role assigned to the scope. Possible values are: "none" - Provides no access; "freeBusyReader" - Provides read access to free/busy information; "reader" - Provides read access to the calendar (private events appear but details are hidden); "writer" - Provides read and write access to the calendar (private events and details are visible); "owner" - Provides ownership of the calendar (all permissions of writer plus ability to see and manipulate ACLs).

scope.title: AclRuleScope

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the scope. Possible values are: "default" - The public scope; "user" - Limits the scope to a single user; "group" - Limits the scope to a group; "domain" - Limits the scope to a domain.

value.title: Value
value.description: The email address of a user or group, or the name of a domain, depending on the scope type. Omitted for type 'default'.

scope.description: The extent to which calendar access is granted by this ACL rule. Optional for patch operations.

rule_id.title: Rule Id
rule_id.description: ACL rule identifier. This is typically in the format 'type:value', such as 'user:email@example.com' or 'group:group@example.com'.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

send_notifications.title: Send Notifications
send_notifications.description: Whether to send notifications about the calendar sharing change. Note that there are no notifications on access removal. Optional. The default is True.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_ADD_ENRICHMENT
tools.description: Adds an enrichment at a specified position in a defined album.

albumId.title: Album Id
albumId.description: Identifier of the album where the enrichment is to be added

albumPosition.title: Album Position

position.title: Position
position.description: Type of position, for a media or enrichment item

relativeMediaItemId.title: Relative Media Item Id
relativeMediaItemId.description: The media item to which the position is relative to. Only used when position type is AFTER_MEDIA_ITEM

relativeEnrichmentItemId.title: Relative Enrichment Item Id
relativeEnrichmentItemId.description: The enrichment item to which the position is relative to. Only used when position type is AFTER_ENRICHMENT_ITEM

albumPosition.description: Position in the album where the enrichment is to be inserted. Valid options are: POSITION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED, FIRST_IN_ALBUM, LAST_IN_ALBUM, AFTER_MEDIA_ITEM, AFTER_ENRICHMENT_ITEM

newEnrichmentItem.title: New Enrichment Item

origin.title: Origin

latlng.title: Latlng
latlng.description: Position of the location on the map

locationName.title: Location Name
locationName.description: Name of the location to be displayed

origin.description: Origin location for this enrichment item

destination.title: Destination

latlng.title: Latlng
latlng.description: Position of the location on the map

locationName.title: Location Name
locationName.description: Name of the location to be displayed

destination.description: Destination location for this enrichment item

latlng.title: Latlng
latlng.description: Position of the location on the map

locationName.title: Location Name
locationName.description: Name of the location to be displayed

newEnrichmentItem.description: The enrichment to be added, can be a text, location, or map enrichment

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_ADD_FILE_SHARING_PREFERENCE
tools.description: Modifies sharing permissions for an existing Google Drive file, granting a specified role to a user, group, domain, or 'anyone'.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of grantee for the permission.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Domain to grant permission to (e.g., 'example.com'). Required if 'type' is 'domain'.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: Unique identifier of the file to update sharing settings for. Use GOOGLEDRIVE_FIND_FILE or GOOGLEDRIVE_LIST_FILES to get valid file IDs from your Google Drive.

email_address.title: Email Address
email_address.description: Email address of the user or group. Required if 'type' is 'user' or 'group'.

transfer_ownership.title: Transfer Ownership
transfer_ownership.description: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user. Required when role is 'owner'. Only a single user can be specified in the request when transferring ownership.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_ADD_LABEL_TO_EMAIL
tools.description: Adds and/or removes specified Gmail labels for a message; ensure `message_id` and all `label_ids` are valid (use 'listLabels' for custom label IDs).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Immutable ID of the message to modify (e.g., from 'fetchEmails' or 'fetchMessagesByThreadId').

add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids
add_label_ids.description: Label IDs to add. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels (e.g., 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT') can be used, but immutable system labels like 'DRAFT' and 'SENT' cannot be added or removed.

remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids
remove_label_ids.description: Label IDs to remove. For custom labels, obtain IDs via 'listLabels'. System labels can be used, but immutable system labels like 'DRAFT' and 'SENT' cannot be added or removed via messages.modify.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_ADD_OR_REMOVE_TO_CUSTOMER_LIST
tools.description: AddOrRemoveToCustomerList Tool will add a contact to a customer list in Google Ads. Note: It takes 6 to 12 hours for changes to be reflected in the customer list.

emails.title: Emails
emails.description: Array of emails of the contacts to be added to the customer list.

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: Operation to be performed on the customer list. Either create or remove.

resource_name.title: Resource Name
resource_name.description: Resource name of the customer list. For example: customers/1234567890/userLists/1234567890

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_ADD_SHEET
tools.description: Adds a new sheet (worksheet) to a spreadsheet. Use this tool to create a new tab within an existing Google Sheet, optionally specifying its title, index, size, and other properties. IMPORTANT: - Always provide the spreadsheetId. Use 'Search Spreadsheets' action if you need to find it by name - Sheet names must be unique within the spreadsheet - For tab colors, use EITHER rgbColor OR themeColor, never both - Index must be less than or equal to the current number of sheets - CONCURRENCY WARNING: Do not use 'index' when creating multiple sheets in parallel - this causes 'index is too high' errors. For parallel creation, omit the index field and let sheets be added at the end Common use cases: - Add a new sheet with a specific name - Insert a sheet at a specific position - Create a sheet with custom colors and formatting

properties.title: SheetProperties

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index where the sheet should be inserted. Must be less than or equal to the current number of sheets. If not set, the sheet will be added at the end. Example: 0 for the first position. CONCURRENCY WARNING: Do not use 'index' when creating multiple sheets in parallel - this causes 'index is too high' errors. For parallel creation, omit this field and let sheets be added at the end.

title.title: Title
title.description: The name of the sheet. Must be unique within the spreadsheet. Example: "Q3 Report", "Sales Data 2025"

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: True if the sheet is hidden in the UI, false if it's visible.

sheetId.title: Sheet Id
sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet. If not set, an ID will be randomly generated. Must be non-negative and unique within the spreadsheet. WARNING: Avoid setting this unless you need a specific ID.

rightToLeft.title: Right To Left
rightToLeft.description: True if the sheet is an RTL sheet, false if it's LTR.

tabColorStyle.title: ColorStyle

rgbColor.title: Color

red.title: Red
red.description: The amount of red in the color as a value in the interval [0, 1].

blue.title: Blue
blue.description: The amount of blue in the color as a value in the interval [0, 1].

alpha.title: Alpha
alpha.description: The fraction of this color that should be applied to the pixel. E.g. 0.5 for 50% transparent.

green.title: Green
green.description: The amount of green in the color as a value in the interval [0, 1].

rgbColor.description: RGB color. Specify EITHER rgbColor OR themeColor, but not both. If using rgbColor, provide values for red, green, blue (0.0-1.0).

themeColor.title: ThemeColorType
themeColor.description: Theme color. Specify EITHER themeColor OR rgbColor, but not both. Use predefined theme colors like ACCENT1, TEXT, BACKGROUND, etc.

tabColorStyle.description: The color of the sheet tab.

gridProperties.title: GridProperties

rowCount.title: Row Count
rowCount.description: The number of rows in the sheet.

columnCount.title: Column Count
columnCount.description: The number of columns in the sheet.

hideGridlines.title: Hide Gridlines
hideGridlines.description: True if the gridlines are hidden, false if they are shown.

frozenRowCount.title: Frozen Row Count
frozenRowCount.description: The number of rows that are frozen in the sheet.

frozenColumnCount.title: Frozen Column Count
frozenColumnCount.description: The number of columns that are frozen in the sheet.

rowGroupControlAfter.title: Row Group Control After
rowGroupControlAfter.description: True if the row group control toggle is shown after the group, false if before.

columnGroupControlAfter.title: Column Group Control After
columnGroupControlAfter.description: True if the column group control toggle is shown after the group, false if before.

gridProperties.description: Additional properties of the sheet if it's a grid sheet.

properties.description: The properties the new sheet should have. All properties are optional. If none are specified, a default sheet will be created.

spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to add the sheet to. This is the long string of characters in the URL of your Google Sheet. Use the 'Search Spreadsheets' action first to find the spreadsheet ID by name if you don't have it.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_AGGREGATE_COLUMN_DATA
tools.description: Searches for rows where a specific column matches a value and performs mathematical operations on data from another column.

inputSchema.title: AggregateColumnDataRequest

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: The mathematical operation to perform on the target column values.

sheet_name.title: Sheet Name
sheet_name.description: The name of the specific sheet within the spreadsheet.

search_value.title: Search Value
search_value.description: The exact value to search for in the search column. Case-sensitive by default.

search_column.title: Search Column
search_column.description: The column to search in. Can be a letter (e.g., 'A', 'B') or column name from header row (e.g., 'Region', 'Department').

target_column.title: Target Column
target_column.description: The column to aggregate data from. Can be a letter (e.g., 'C', 'D') or column name from header row (e.g., 'Sales', 'Revenue').

case_sensitive.title: Case Sensitive
case_sensitive.description: Whether the search should be case-sensitive.

has_header_row.title: Has Header Row
has_header_row.description: Whether the first row contains column headers. If True, column names can be used for search_column and target_column.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet.

percentage_total.title: Percentage Total
percentage_total.description: For percentage operation, the total value to calculate percentage against. If not provided, uses sum of all values in target column.

inputSchema.description: Request to search for rows matching a column value and aggregate data from another column.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_APPEND_DIMENSION
tools.description: Tool to append new rows or columns to a sheet, increasing its size. Use when you need to add empty rows or columns to an existing sheet.

length.title: Length
length.description: The number of rows or columns to append.

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet to append rows or columns to.

dimension.title: Dimension
dimension.description: Specifies whether to append rows or columns.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_ADD_MEDIA_ITEMS
tools.description: Adds one or more media items to an album in Google Photos.

albumId.title: Album Id
albumId.description: Identifier of the Album that the media items are added to

mediaItemIds.title: Media Item Ids
mediaItemIds.description: Identifiers of the MediaItems to be added. Maximum 50 items.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_CREATE_MEDIA_ITEMS
tools.description: Unified action to upload media files and create them as items in Google Photos.

name.title: Name
name.description: The filename that will be used when uploading the file to the destination service

s3key.title: S3Key
s3key.description: The S3 key of a publicly accessible file, typically returned from a previous download action that stored the file in S3. This key references an existing file that can be uploaded to another service.

mimetype.title: Mimetype
mimetype.description: The MIME type of the file

files.title: Files
files.description: List of media files to upload and create as media items.

albumId.title: Album Id
albumId.description: Identifier of the album where the media items are to be added.

albumPosition.title: Album Position

relativeMediaItemId.title: Relative Media Item Id
relativeMediaItemId.description: The media item to which the position is relative.

relativeEnrichmentItemId.title: Relative Enrichment Item Id
relativeEnrichmentItemId.description: The enrichment item to which the position is relative.

albumPosition.description: Position in the album to add the media items.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_DELETE_MESSAGES
tools.description: Tool to permanently delete multiple Gmail messages in bulk. Use when you need to efficiently remove large numbers of emails (e.g., retention enforcement, mailbox hygiene).

inputSchema.title: BatchDeleteMessagesRequest

ids.title: Ids
ids.description: List of message IDs to delete. Obtain IDs via list or fetch actions.

userId.title: User Id
userId.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

inputSchema.description: Request model for bulk deletion of Gmail messages by ID.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_GET
tools.description: Retrieves data from specified cell ranges in a Google Spreadsheet.

ranges.title: Ranges
ranges.description: A list of cell ranges in A1 notation (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:B2', 'A1:C5') from which to retrieve data. If this list is omitted or empty, all data from the first sheet of the spreadsheet will be fetched. A range can specify a sheet name (e.g., 'Sheet2!A:A'); if no sheet name is provided in a range string (e.g., 'A1:B2'), it defaults to the first sheet. For sheet names with spaces or special characters, enclose in single quotes (e.g., "'My Sheet'!A1:B2").

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet from which data will be retrieved. This is the ID found in the spreadsheet URL after /d/.

valueRenderOption.title: Value Render Option
valueRenderOption.description: How values should be rendered in the output. FORMATTED_VALUE: Values are calculated and formatted (default). UNFORMATTED_VALUE: Values are calculated but not formatted. FORMULA: Values are not calculated; the formula is returned instead.

dateTimeRenderOption.title: Date Time Render Option
dateTimeRenderOption.description: How dates and times should be rendered in the output. SERIAL_NUMBER: Dates are returned as serial numbers (default). FORMATTED_STRING: Dates returned as formatted strings.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_GET_MEDIA_ITEMS
tools.description: Returns the list of media items for the specified media item identifiers.

mediaItemIds.title: Media Item Ids
mediaItemIds.description: Identifiers of the media items to be requested. Must not contain duplicates.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_MODIFY_MESSAGES
tools.description: Modify labels on multiple Gmail messages in one efficient API call. Supports up to 1,000 messages per request for bulk operations like archiving, marking as read/unread, or applying custom labels.

userId.title: User Id
userId.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

messageIds.title: Message Ids
messageIds.description: List of message IDs to modify. Maximum 1,000 message IDs per request. Get message IDs from GMAIL_FETCH_EMAILS or GMAIL_LIST_THREADS actions.

addLabelIds.title: Add Label Ids
addLabelIds.description: List of label IDs to add to the messages. Common label IDs: INBOX, STARRED, IMPORTANT, SENT, DRAFT, SPAM, TRASH, UNREAD. Use GMAIL_LIST_LABELS to get custom label IDs. Leave empty to skip adding labels.

removeLabelIds.title: Remove Label Ids
removeLabelIds.description: List of label IDs to remove from the messages. Common use cases: Remove 'UNREAD' to mark as read, remove 'INBOX' to archive, remove 'SPAM' to unmark spam. Leave empty to skip removing labels.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_RUN_REPORTS
tools.description: Tool to return multiple analytics data reports in a batch. Use when you need to fetch multiple reports for one GA4 property in a single request.

inputSchema.title: BatchRunReportsRequest

property.title: Property
property.description: Required. The property resource name. Format: properties/{property_id}

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: Required. Up to 5 individual RunReportRequest objects.

inputSchema.description: Request model for executing multiple report requests in a batch.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_UPDATE
tools.description: Updates a specified range in a Google Sheet with given values, or appends them as new rows if `first_cell_location` is omitted. Auto-expands grid for large datasets, preventing range errors. Requirements: Target sheet must exist and spreadsheet must contain at least one worksheet.

inputSchema.title: BatchUpdateRequest

values.title: Values
values.description: A 2D array of cell values where each inner array represents a row. Values can be strings, numbers, booleans, or None/null for empty cells. Ensure columns are properly aligned across rows.

sheet_name.title: Sheet Name
sheet_name.description: The name of the specific sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet to update. Case-sensitive.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet to be updated. Can be found in the spreadsheet URL.

valueInputOption.title: Value Input Option
valueInputOption.description: How input data should be interpreted. 'USER_ENTERED': Values are parsed as if typed by a user (e.g., strings may become numbers/dates, formulas are calculated). 'RAW': Values are stored exactly as provided without parsing (e.g., '123' stays as string, '=SUM(A1:B1)' is not calculated).

first_cell_location.title: First Cell Location
first_cell_location.description: The starting cell for the update range, specified in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1', 'B2'). The update will extend from this cell to the right and down, based on the provided values. If omitted, values are appended to the sheet.

includeValuesInResponse.title: Include Values In Response
includeValuesInResponse.description: If set to True, the response will include the updated values from the spreadsheet after the update is applied.

inputSchema.description: Request to update a range of cells or append new rows in a Google Sheet with specified values.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_BATCH_UPDATE_VALUES_BY_DATA_FILTER
tools.description: Tool to update values in ranges matching data filters. Use when you need to update specific data in a Google Sheet based on criteria rather than fixed cell ranges.

values.title: Values
values.description: The data to be written. A two-dimensional array of values that will be written to the range. Values can be strings, numbers, or booleans. If the range is larger than the values array, the excess cells will not be changed. If the values array is larger than the range, the excess values will be ignored.

dataFilter.title: Data Filter

a1Range.title: A1 Range
a1Range.description: The A1 notation of the range to update.

gridRange.title: GridRange

sheetId.title: Sheet Id
sheetId.description: The sheet this range is on.

endRowIndex.title: End Row Index
endRowIndex.description: The end row (exclusive) of the range, or not set if unbounded.

startRowIndex.title: Start Row Index
startRowIndex.description: The start row (inclusive) of the range, or not set if unbounded.

endColumnIndex.title: End Column Index
endColumnIndex.description: The end column (exclusive) of the range, or not set if unbounded.

startColumnIndex.title: Start Column Index
startColumnIndex.description: The start column (inclusive) of the range, or not set if unbounded.

gridRange.description: Selects data within the range described by a GridRange. This field is optional. If specified, the dataFilter selects data within the specified grid range.

developerMetadataLookup.title: DeveloperMetadataLookup

metadataId.title: Metadata Id
metadataId.description: The ID of the developer metadata to match. This field is optional. If specified, the lookup matches only the developer metadata with the specified ID.

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: The visibility of the developer metadata to match. This field is optional. If specified, the lookup matches only the developer metadata with the specified visibility.

metadataKey.title: Metadata Key
metadataKey.description: The key of the developer metadata to match. This field is optional. If specified, the lookup matches only the developer metadata with the specified key.

locationType.title: Location Type
locationType.description: The type of location this object is looking for. Valid values are ROW, COLUMN, and SHEET.

metadataValue.title: Metadata Value
metadataValue.description: The value of the developer metadata to match. This field is optional. If specified, the lookup matches only the developer metadata with the specified value.

metadataLocation.title: DeveloperMetadataLocation

sheetId.title: Sheet Id
sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet the location is on.

spreadsheet.title: Spreadsheet
spreadsheet.description: True if the metadata location is the spreadsheet itself.

locationType.title: Location Type
locationType.description: The type of location this object represents. This field is read-only.

dimensionRange.title: Dimension Range
dimensionRange.description: A range along a single dimension on a sheet. All indexes are 0-based. Indexes are half open: the start index is inclusive and the end index is exclusive. Missing indexes indicate the range is unbounded on that side.

metadataLocation.description: The location of the developer metadata to match. This field is optional. If specified, the lookup matches only the developer metadata in the specified location.

locationMatchingStrategy.title: Location Matching Strategy
locationMatchingStrategy.description: Determines how this lookup matches the location. If this field is specified as EXACT, then the lookup requires an exact match of the specified locationType, metadataKey, and metadataValue. If this field is specified as INTERSECTING, then the lookup considers all metadata that intersects the specified locationType, and then filters that metadata by the specified key and value. If this field is unspecified, it is treated as EXACT.

developerMetadataLookup.description: Matches the data against the developer metadata that's associated with the dimensions. The developer metadata should be created with the location type set to either ROW or COLUMN and the visibility set to DOCUMENT.

dataFilter.description: The data filter describing the criteria to select cells for update.

majorDimension.title: Major Dimension
majorDimension.description: The major dimension of the values. The default value is ROWS.

data.title: Data
data.description: The new values to apply to the spreadsheet. If more than one range is matched by the specified DataFilter the specified values are applied to all of those ranges.

spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

valueInputOption.title: Value Input Option
valueInputOption.description: How the input data should be interpreted.

includeValuesInResponse.title: Include Values In Response
includeValuesInResponse.description: Determines if the update response should include the values of the cells that were updated. By default, responses do not include the updated values.

responseValueRenderOption.title: Response Value Render Option
responseValueRenderOption.description: Determines how values in the response should be rendered. The default render option is FORMATTED_VALUE.

responseDateTimeRenderOption.title: Response Date Time Render Option
responseDateTimeRenderOption.description: Determines how dates, times, and durations in the response should be rendered. This is ignored if responseValueRenderOption is FORMATTED_VALUE. The default dateTime render option is SERIAL_NUMBER.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CALENDAR_LIST_INSERT
tools.description: Inserts an existing calendar into the user's calendar list.

id.title: Id
id.description: The identifier of the calendar to insert.

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list. Default is False.

color_id.title: Color Id
color_id.description: The color of the calendar. This is an ID referring to an entry in the calendarCore color palette.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: Whether the calendar is selected and visible in the calendar list. Default is True.

background_color.title: Background Color
background_color.description: The background color of the calendar in the Web UI. (Hexadecimal color code)

color_rgb_format.title: Color Rgb Format
color_rgb_format.description: Whether to use the foregroundColor and backgroundColor fields to write the calendar colors (RGB). If this feature is used, the index-based colorId field will be set to the best matching option automatically. Optional. The default is False.

foreground_color.title: Foreground Color
foreground_color.description: The foreground color of the calendar in the Web UI. (Hexadecimal color code)

summary_override.title: Summary Override
summary_override.description: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar.

method.title: Method
method.description: The method used by this reminder (e.g., 'email', 'popup').

minutes.title: Minutes
minutes.description: Number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger.

default_reminders.title: Default Reminders
default_reminders.description: The default reminders that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

notification_settings.title: NotificationSetting

method.title: Method
method.description: The method used by this notification (e.g., 'email').

notification_settings.description: The notifications that the authenticated user is receiving for this calendar.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CALENDAR_LIST_UPDATE
tools.description: Updates an existing entry on the user\'s calendar list.

colorId.title: Color Id
colorId.description: ID for calendar color from colors endpoint.

selected.title: Selected
selected.description: Whether calendar content shows in UI.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. Must be an actual calendar ID (e.g., calendar email address like "examplecalendar@group.calendar.google.com"). The "primary" alias is not valid for calendarList.update - use the actual calendar ID.

colorRgbFormat.title: Color Rgb Format
colorRgbFormat.description: Whether to use RGB for foreground/background colors.

method.title: Method
method.description: Method for the reminder (e.g., email, popup).

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CALENDARS_DELETE
tools.description: Deletes a secondary calendar. Use calendars.clear for clearing all events on primary calendars.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CALENDARS_UPDATE
tools.description: Updates metadata for a calendar.

location.title: Location
location.description: Geographic location of the calendar as free-form text. Optional.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: The time zone of the calendar. (Formatted as an IANA Time Zone Database name, e.g. "Europe/Zurich".) Optional.

calendarId.title: Calendar Id
calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CHECK_COMPATIBILITY
tools.description: Tool to list dimensions and metrics compatible with a GA4 report request. Use when you need to validate compatibility of chosen dimensions or metrics before running a report.

inputSchema.title: CheckCompatibilityRequest

items.title: Metric

name.title: Name
name.description: The API name of the metric, e.g., 'activeUsers'.

items.description: Model for a metric in a compatibility check request.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.description: Optional. List of metrics to check compatibility for.

property.title: Property
property.description: Required. GA4 property resource name. Format: properties/{property_id}.

items.title: Dimension

name.title: Name
name.description: The API name of the dimension, e.g., 'country'.

items.description: Model for a dimension in a compatibility check request.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: Optional. List of dimensions to check compatibility for.

metricFilter.title: Metric Filter
metricFilter.description: Optional. A FilterExpression for metrics; must follow GA4 FilterExpression JSON schema.

dimensionFilter.title: Dimension Filter
dimensionFilter.description: Optional. A FilterExpression for dimensions; must follow GA4 FilterExpression JSON schema.

compatibilityFilter.title: CompatibilityEnum
compatibilityFilter.description: Compatibility status for dimensions or metrics.

inputSchema.description: Request model for the checkCompatibility method.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CLEAR_BASIC_FILTER
tools.description: Tool to clear the basic filter from a sheet. Use when you need to remove an existing basic filter from a specific sheet within a Google Spreadsheet.

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet on which the basic filter should be cleared.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet from which to clear values. This ID can be found in the URL of the spreadsheet.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_COMPUTE_ROUTE_MATRIX
tools.description: Calculates travel distance and duration matrix between multiple origins and destinations using the modern Routes API; supports OAuth2 authentication and various travel modes.

inputSchema.title: ComputeRouteMatrixRequest

units.title: Units
units.description: Unit system (e.g., 'METRIC' for kilometers, 'IMPERIAL' for miles) for displaying distances.

items.title: RouteMatrixOriginDestination

address.title: Address
address.description: Address as a string. Provide either address or latitude/longitude.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with longitude.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with latitude.

items.description: A single origin or destination location for the route matrix.

origins.title: Origins
origins.description: List of origin locations. Each can be specified as an address or latitude/longitude coordinates.

fieldMask.title: Field Mask
fieldMask.description: Comma-separated list of response fields to include (e.g., 'originIndex,destinationIndex,duration,distanceMeters'). Use '*' for all fields.

travelMode.title: Travel Mode
travelMode.description: Mode of transportation for the route matrix calculation.

items.title: RouteMatrixOriginDestination

address.title: Address
address.description: Address as a string. Provide either address or latitude/longitude.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with longitude.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude in decimal degrees. Must be used with latitude.

items.description: A single origin or destination location for the route matrix.

destinations.title: Destinations
destinations.description: List of destination locations. Each can be specified as an address or latitude/longitude coordinates.

languageCode.title: Language Code
languageCode.description: BCP-47 language code (e.g., 'en-US', 'es') for textual information.

routingPreference.title: Routing Preference
routingPreference.description: Specifies routing preference: `TRAFFIC_UNAWARE` (fastest, ignores traffic), `TRAFFIC_AWARE` (considers traffic, optimized), `TRAFFIC_AWARE_OPTIMAL` (most accurate traffic-based routing), or `ROUTING_PREFERENCE_UNSPECIFIED` (behavior similar to `TRAFFIC_UNAWARE`).

inputSchema.description: Parameters for computing a route matrix between multiple origins and destinations.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_COPY_DOCUMENT

The copied document will have a default title (e.g., 'Copy of [original title]') if no new title is provided, and will be placed in the user's root Google Drive folder.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the new copied document. If not provided, the title will be 'Copy of [original document's title]'.

document_id.title: Document Id

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_COPY_FILE

file_id.description: The unique identifier for the file on Google Drive that you want to copy. This ID can be retrieved from the file's shareable link or via other Google Drive API calls.

new_title.title: New Title
new_title.description: The title to assign to the new copy of the file. If not provided, the copied file will have the same title as the original, prefixed with 'Copy of '.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_ALBUM

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_CHART
tools.description: Create a chart in a Google Sheets spreadsheet using the specified data range and chart type. Conditional requirements: - Provide either a simple chart via chart_type + data_range (basicChart), OR supply a full chart_spec supporting all chart types. Exactly one approach should be used. - When using chart_spec, set exactly one of the union fields (basicChart | pieChart | bubbleChart | candlestickChart | histogramChart | waterfallChart | treemapChart | orgChart | scorecardChart).

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The sheetId of the worksheet where the chart will be created. This is a unique non-zero integer identifier. Use 'Get Sheet Names' or 'Get Spreadsheet Info' actions to retrieve the sheetId for your target worksheet.

chart_spec.title: Chart Spec
chart_spec.description: Optional full ChartSpec object to send to the Google Sheets API. Use this to support ALL chart types and advanced options. Must set exactly one of: basicChart, pieChart, bubbleChart, candlestickChart, histogramChart, treemapChart, waterfallChart, orgChart, scorecardChart. See https://developers.google.com/workspace/sheets/api/reference/rest/v4/spreadsheets/charts#ChartSpec.

chart_type.title: Chart Type
chart_type.description: The type of chart to create. Supported types: BAR, LINE, AREA, COLUMN, SCATTER, COMBO, STEPPED_AREA (basic charts), PIE, BUBBLE, CANDLESTICK, HISTOGRAM, TREEMAP, WATERFALL, ORG, SCORECARD. If you need full control over the chart specification (including fields not covered by simple inputs), provide chart_spec instead.

data_range.title: Data Range
data_range.description: A single contiguous range of data for the chart in A1 notation (e.g., 'A1:C10' or 'Sheet1!B2:D20'). Must be a single continuous range - comma-separated multi-ranges (e.g., 'A1:A10,C1:C10') are not supported. When chart_spec is not provided, the first column is used as the domain/labels and the remaining columns as series.

background_red.title: Background Red
background_red.description: Red component of chart background color (0.0-1.0). If not specified, uses default.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet where the chart will be created.

background_blue.title: Background Blue
background_blue.description: Blue component of chart background color (0.0-1.0). If not specified, uses default.

legend_position.title: Legend Position
legend_position.description: Position of the chart legend. Options: BOTTOM_LEGEND, TOP_LEGEND, LEFT_LEGEND, RIGHT_LEGEND, NO_LEGEND.

background_green.title: Background Green
background_green.description: Green component of chart background color (0.0-1.0). If not specified, uses default.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_COMMENT
tools.description: Tool to create a comment on a file. Use when you need to add a new comment to a specific file in Google Drive.

anchor.title: Anchor
anchor.description: A JSON string representing the region of the document to which the comment is anchored (e.g., {'type': 'line', 'line': 12}).

content.title: Content
content.description: The plain text content of the comment.

quoted_file_content_value.title: Quoted File Content Value
examples: This is the text to quote.

quoted_file_content_mime_type.title: Quoted File Content Mime Type
quoted_file_content_mime_type.description: The MIME type of the quoted content.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_CUSTOMER_LIST
tools.description: CreateCustomerList Tool will create a customer list in Google Ads.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_DOCUMENT
tools.description: Creates a new Google Docs document using the provided title as filename and inserts the initial text at the beginning if non-empty, returning the document's ID and metadata (excluding body content).

text.title: Text
examples: This document outlines the key findings...
text.description: Initial text content to insert at the beginning of the new document.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title for the new document, used as its filename in Google Drive.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_DOCUMENT_MARKDOWN
tools.description: Creates a new Google Docs document, optionally initializing it with a title and content provided as Markdown text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title for the new Google Docs document.

markdown_text.title: Markdown Text
markdown_text.description: The initial content for the document, formatted as Markdown. Supports various Markdown elements including headings, lists (nested lists are not supported), tables, images (via publicly accessible URLs), blockquotes, code blocks, and text formatting (bold, italic, etc.). If an empty string is provided, the document will be created with only the title. Image URL constraints: URLs must be less than or equal to 2KB in length. Supported image formats: JPEG, PNG, GIF (SVG is not supported).

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_DRIVE
tools.description: Tool to create a new shared drive. Use when you need to programmatically create a new shared drive for collaboration or storage.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of this shared drive.

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

themeId.title: Theme Id
themeId.description: The ID of the theme from which the background image and color will be set. The set of possible driveThemes can be retrieved from a drive.about.get response. When not specified on a drive.drives.create request, a random theme is chosen from which the background image and color are set. This is a write-only field; it can only be set on requests that don't set colorRgb or backgroundImageFile.

colorRgb.title: Color Rgb
colorRgb.description: The color of this shared drive as an RGB hex string. It can only be set on a drive.drives.update request that does not set themeId.

requestId.title: Request Id
requestId.description: An ID, such as a random UUID, which uniquely identifies this user's request for idempotent creation of a shared drive. A repeated request by the same user and with the same request ID will avoid creating duplicates by attempting to create the same shared drive. If the shared drive already exists a 409 error will be returned.

backgroundImageFile.title: BackgroundImageFile

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of an image file in Google Drive to use for the background.

width.title: Width
width.description: The width of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= width <= 1.0.

xCoordinate.title: X Coordinate
xCoordinate.description: The X coordinate of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= xCoordinate <= 1.0.

yCoordinate.title: Y Coordinate
yCoordinate.description: The Y coordinate of the cropped image in the range: 0.0 <= yCoordinate <= 1.0.

backgroundImageFile.description: An image file and cropping parameters from which a background image for this shared drive is set. This is a write only field; it can only be set on drive.drives.update requests that don't set themeId. When specified, all fields of the backgroundImageFile must be set.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_EMAIL_DRAFT
tools.description: Creates a Gmail email draft, requiring at least one of recipient_email, cc, or bcc must be provided. Atleast one of subject or body must be provided. Supports To/Cc/Bcc, subject, plain/HTML body (ensure `is_html=True` for HTML), attachments, and threading. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave subject empty to stay in the same thread; setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.

cc.title: Cc
cc.description: Carbon Copy (CC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.

bcc.title: Bcc
bcc.description: Blind Carbon Copy (BCC) recipients' email addresses. Atleast one of cc, bcc, or recipient_email must be provided.

body.title: Body
examples:
Hello Team,

Please find the attached report for your review.

Best regards,
Your Name

Meeting Confirmation

This email confirms our meeting scheduled for next Tuesday.
body.description: Email body content (plain text or HTML); `is_html` must be True if HTML. Either subject or body must be provided.

is_html.title: Is Html
is_html.description: Set to True if `body` is HTML, otherwise the action may fail.

subject.title: Subject
subject.description: Email subject line. Either subject or body must be provided. When creating a draft reply to an existing thread (thread_id provided), leave this empty to stay in the same thread. Setting a subject will create a NEW thread instead.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: ID of an existing Gmail thread to reply to; omit for new thread.

attachment.title: FileUploadable
attachment.description: File to attach to the email.

recipient_email.title: Recipient Email
recipient_email.description: Primary recipient's email address. Required if cc and bcc is not provided, else can be optional. Use extra_recipients if you want to send to multiple recipients.

extra_recipients.title: Extra Recipients
extra_recipients.description: Additional 'To' recipients' email addresses (not Cc or Bcc). Should only be used if recipient_email is also provided.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_EVENT
tools.description: Create a Google Calendar event using `start_datetime` plus `event_duration_hour` and `event_duration_minutes` fields to derive the end time. Requires calendar write access. The organizer is added as an attendee unless `exclude_organizer` is True. Example request to create event for 1 hour 30 minutes: { "calendar_id": "primary", "start_datetime": "2025-01-16T13:00:00", "timezone": "America/New_York", "event_duration_hour": 1, "event_duration_minutes": 30, "summary": "Client sync", "attendees": [{"email": "guest@example.com"}] }

location.title: Location
location.description: Geographic location of the event as free-form text.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: IANA timezone name (e.g., 'America/New_York'). Required if datetime is naive. For recurring events, start and end must include a timeZone. If not provided, UTC is used. If datetime includes timezone info (Z or offset), this field is optional and defaults to UTC.

eventType.title: Event Type
eventType.description: Type of the event, immutable post-creation. 'workingLocation' (REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise). Note: 'fromGmail' events cannot be created via API.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: List of RRULE, EXRULE, RDATE, EXDATE lines for recurring events. Supported frequencies: DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, YEARLY. For recurring events, start.timeZone and end.timeZone must be present. Provide an empty list to remove recurrence so the event becomes non-recurring.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Target calendar: 'primary' for the user's main calendar, or the calendar's email address. Must be provided in snake_case format.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the event. Can contain HTML. Optional. Must be omitted for 'birthday' event type.

send_updates.title: Send Updates
send_updates.description: Defaults to True. Whether to send updates to the attendees.

start_datetime.title: Start Datetime
start_datetime.description: Event start time in format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS (no fractional seconds, no 'Z', no timezone offsets). Examples: '2025-01-16T13:00:00' or '2025-01-16T13:00'. Timezone info (Z, +, -) will be automatically stripped if provided.

exclude_organizer.title: Exclude Organizer
exclude_organizer.description: If True, the organizer will NOT be added as an attendee. Default is False (organizer is included).

guests_can_modify.title: Guests Can Modify
guests_can_modify.description: If True, guests can modify the event.

type.title: BirthdayType
type.description: Type of birthday event: 'birthday', 'anniversary', or 'other'. Default 'birthday' works without contact field.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Contact ID in format 'people/c12345' from Google People API. REQUIRED when type is not 'birthday'.

customTypeName.title: Custom Type Name
customTypeName.description: Custom type name when type is 'other'. Requires valid contact field.

create_meeting_room.title: Create Meeting Room
create_meeting_room.description: If true, a Google Meet link is created and added to the event. CRITICAL: As of 2024, this REQUIRES a paid Google Workspace account ($13+/month). Personal Gmail accounts will fail with 'Invalid conference type value' error. Solutions: 1) Upgrade to Workspace, 2) Use domain-wide delegation with Workspace user, 3) Use the new Google Meet REST API, or 4) Create events without conferences. See https://github.com/googleapis/google-api-nodejs-client/issues/3234

event_duration_hour.title: Event Duration Hour
event_duration_hour.description: Number of hours (0-24). Increase by 1 here rather than passing 60 in `event_duration_minutes`

focusTimeProperties.title: FocusTimeProperties

chatStatus.title: ChatStatus
chatStatus.description: Chat status during focus time: 'active' or 'doNotDisturb'.

declineMessage.title: Decline Message
declineMessage.description: Message to include in declined meeting invitations. Only used when autoDeclineMode is set.

autoDeclineMode.title: AutoDeclineMode
autoDeclineMode.description: Auto decline mode: 'declineNone' (no invitations declined), 'declineAllConflictingInvitations' (all conflicting invitations declined), or 'declineOnlyNewConflictingInvitations' (only new conflicting invitations declined).

focusTimeProperties.description: Properties for focusTime events. REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise account with Focus Time feature enabled.

guestsCanInviteOthers.title: Guests Can Invite Others
guestsCanInviteOthers.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can invite others to the event.

declineMessage.title: Decline Message
declineMessage.description: Message to include in declined meeting invitations. Only used when autoDeclineMode is set.

autoDeclineMode.title: AutoDeclineMode
autoDeclineMode.description: Auto decline mode: 'declineNone' (no invitations declined), 'declineAllConflictingInvitations' (all conflicting invitations declined), or 'declineOnlyNewConflictingInvitations' (only new conflicting invitations declined).

event_duration_minutes.title: Event Duration Minutes
event_duration_minutes.description: Duration in minutes (0-59 ONLY). NEVER use 60+ minutes - use event_duration_hour=1 instead. Maximum value is 59. Combined duration (hours + minutes) must be greater than 0.

guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.title: Guests Can See Other Guests
guestsCanSeeOtherGuests.description: Whether attendees other than the organizer can see who the event's attendees are.

workingLocationProperties.title: WorkingLocationProperties

homeOffice.title: WorkingLocationHomeOffice
homeOffice.description:
Empty object marker for home office working location.

This is used to indicate the user is working from home.
Google Calendar API accepts an empty object for this field.

customLocation.title: WorkingLocationCustom

label.title: Label
label.description: Label for a custom working location (e.g., 'Client site').

customLocation.description: Custom working location with a display label.

label.title: Label
label.description: Office name displayed in Calendar clients (e.g., building name).

buildingId.title: Building Id
buildingId.description: Optional building identifier from org Resources.

workingLocationProperties.description:
Properties for workingLocation events. REQUIRES Google Workspace Enterprise.

Constraints discovered from testing:
- Must set transparency='transparent' and visibility='public'
- Description must be omitted
- Depending on 'type', include one of 'homeOffice', 'officeLocation', or 'customLocation'

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_FILE

fields.title: Fields

starred.title: Starred

mimeType.title: Mime Type

file_name.title: File Name

mime_type.title: Mime Type
mime_type.description: MIME type for the new file, determining how Google Drive interprets its content.

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: ID of the parent folder in Google Drive; if omitted, the file is created in the root of 'My Drive'. Must be a valid Google Drive folder ID, not a folder name. Use GOOGLEDRIVE_FIND_FOLDER to get the folder ID from a folder name.

text_content.title: Text Content

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: ID or exact name of the parent folder. If a name is provided, the action searches for a folder with that exact name. If an ID is provided, it must be a valid Google Drive folder ID (not a shared drive ID). If omitted, the folder is created in the Drive root.

folder_name.title: Folder Name
folder_name.description: Name for the new folder. This is a required field.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_FOOTER
tools.description: Tool to create a new footer in a Google Document. Use when you need to add a footer, optionally specifying its type and the section it applies to.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of footer to create.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to create the footer in.

section_break_location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

section_break_location.description: The location of the SectionBreak immediately preceding the section whose SectionStyle this footer should belong to. If this is unset or refers to the first section break in the document, the footer applies to the document style.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_FOOTNOTE
tools.description: Tool to create a new footnote in a Google Document. Use this when you need to add a footnote at a specific location or at the end of the document body.

location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units. The index is relative to the beginning of the segment specified by segment_id.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

location.description: Inserts the footnote reference at a specific index in the document. The segmentId within this Location object must be empty as footnotes can only be inserted in the document body.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to create the footnote in.

endOfSegmentLocation.title: EndOfSegmentLocation

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

endOfSegmentLocation.description: Inserts the footnote reference at the end of the document body. The segmentId within this EndOfSegmentLocation object must be empty.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_GOOGLE_SHEET1

sectionBreakLocation.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units.

tabId.title: Tab Id

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

sectionBreakLocation.description: The location of the SectionBreak which begins the section this header should belong to.
