tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_LABEL
tools.description: Creates a new label with a unique name in the specified user's Gmail account.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The email address of the user in whose account the label will be created.

label_name.title: Label Name
label_name.description: The name for the new label. Must be unique within the account, non-blank, maximum length 225 characters, cannot contain ',', '/', or '.' (period), not only whitespace, and must not be a reserved system label (e.g., INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, SPAM, TRASH, ALL_MAIL, CATEGORY_*).

text_color.title: GmailLabelColor
text_color.description: Text color for the label. Must be selected from Gmail's predefined color palette of over 100 colors (not arbitrary hex values). If setting a color, both text_color and background_color must be provided. See the anthropic Color field documentation for the full palette: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/reference/rest/v1/users.labels#Color

background_color.title: GmailLabelColor
background_color.description: Background color for the label. Must be selected from Gmail's predefined color palette of over 100 colors (not arbitrary hex values). If setting a color, both background_color and text_color must be provided. See the anthropic Color field documentation for the full palette: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/reference/rest/v1/users.labels#Color

label_list_visibility.title: Label List Visibility
label_list_visibility.description: Controls how the label is displayed in the label list in the Gmail sidebar.

message_list_visibility.title: Message List Visibility
message_list_visibility.description: Controls how messages with this label are displayed in the message list.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_MEET
tools.description: Creates a new Google Meet space, optionally configuring its access type and entry point access controls.

access_type.title: Access Type
access_type.description: Access control level for the meeting space.

entry_point_access.title: Entry Point Access
entry_point_access.description: Access control for meeting entry points.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_NAMED_RANGE
tools.description: Tool to create a new named range in a Google Document. Use this to assign a name to a specific part of the document for easier reference or programmatic manipulation.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new named range. Must be 1-256 characters.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document where the named range will be created.

rangeEndIndex.title: Range End Index
rangeEndIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range.

rangeSegmentId.title: Range Segment Id
rangeSegmentId.description: Optional. The ID of the header, footer, or footnote. Empty for document body.

rangeStartIndex.title: Range Start Index
rangeStartIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_PARAGRAPH_BULLETS
tools.description: Tool to add bullets to paragraphs within a specified range in a Google Document. Use when you need to format a list or a set of paragraphs as bullet points.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

range.title: Range

endIndex.title: End Index
endIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range, exclusive.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer, or footnote that this range is contained in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

startIndex.title: Start Index
startIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range, inclusive.

range.description: The range to apply the bullet preset to.

bulletPreset.title: Bullet Preset
bulletPreset.description: The kinds of bullet glyphs to be used.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_REPLY
tools.description: Tool to create a reply to a comment in Google Drive. Use when you need to respond to an existing comment on a file.

action.title: Action
action.description: The action the reply performed to the parent comment. Valid values are: resolve, reopen.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

content.title: Content
content.description: The plain text content of the reply. HTML content is not supported.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_ROLLUP_PROPERTY
tools.description: Tool to create a GA4 Roll-up Property and optionally initial source links.

inputSchema.title: CreateRollupPropertyRequest

account.title: Account
account.description: Required. Parent account resource. Format: accounts/{account_id}

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Required. IANA time zone for the roll-up property.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: Required. Display name for the roll-up property.

sourceProperties.title: Source Properties
sourceProperties.description: Optional. List of source property resource names to link. Format: properties/{property_id}.

inputSchema.description: Request model for creating a GA4 Roll-up Property using properties.createRollupProperty.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_SHORTCUT_TO_FILE
tools.description: Tool to create a shortcut to a file or folder in Google Drive. Use when you need to link to an existing Drive item from another location without duplicating it.

target_id.title: Target Id
target_id.description: The ID of the file or folder that this shortcut points to.

includeLabels.title: Include Labels
includeLabels.description: A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in the labelInfo part of the response.

target_mime_type.title: Target Mime Type
target_mime_type.description: The MIME type of the target file or folder. While optional, providing it can be helpful.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Recommended to set to true if interacting with shared drives.

keepRevisionForever.title: Keep Revision Forever
keepRevisionForever.description: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision.

ignoreDefaultVisibility.title: Ignore Default Visibility
ignoreDefaultVisibility.description: Whether to ignore the domain's default visibility settings for the created file.

includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View
includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_SPREADSHEET_COLUMN
tools.description: Creates a new column in a Google Spreadsheet, requiring a valid `spreadsheet_id` and an existing `sheet_id`; an out-of-bounds `insert_index` may append/prepend the column.

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The numeric identifier of the specific sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet where the column will be added.

insert_index.title: Insert Index
insert_index.description: The 0-based index at which the new column will be inserted. For example, an index of 0 inserts the column before the current first column (A), and an index of 1 inserts it between the current columns A and B.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet where the column will be created.

inherit_from_before.title: Inherit From Before
inherit_from_before.description: If true, the new column inherits properties (e.g., formatting, width) from the column immediately to its left (the preceding column). If false (default), it inherits from the column immediately to its right (the succeeding column). This is ignored if there is no respective preceding or succeeding column.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_SPREADSHEET_ROW
tools.description: Inserts a new, empty row into a specified sheet of a Google Spreadsheet at a given index, optionally inheriting formatting from the row above.

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The numeric identifier of the sheet (tab) within the spreadsheet where the row will be inserted. This ID (gid) is found in the URL of the spreadsheet (e.g., '0' for the first sheet).

insert_index.title: Insert Index
insert_index.description: The 0-based index at which the new row should be inserted. For example, an index of 0 inserts the row at the beginning of the sheet. If the index is greater than the current number of rows, the row is appended.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet. This ID is found in the URL of the spreadsheet (e.g., '1qpyC0XzHc_-_d824s2VfopkHh7D0jW4aXCS1D_AlGA').

inherit_from_before.title: Inherit From Before
inherit_from_before.description: If True, the newly inserted row will inherit formatting and properties from the row immediately preceding its insertion point. If False, it will have default formatting.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_CREATE_TASK_LIST
tools.description: Creates a new task list with the specified title.

tasklist_title.title: Tasklist Title
tasklist_title.description: Title for the new task list. The maximum allowed length is 1024 characters.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_COMMENT
tools.description: Deletes a comment from a file. Use when you need to remove a specific comment from a Google Drive file.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_CONTENT_RANGE
tools.description: Tool to delete a range of content from a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a specific portion of text or other structural elements within a document.

range.title: Range

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The ID of the tab the range is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab. In a document with a single tab, if provided, it must match the singular tab's ID; if omitted, it applies to the singular tab. In a multi-tab document, if provided, it applies to the specified tab; if omitted, it applies to the first tab.

endIndex.title: End Index
endIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer, or footnote the range is in. An empty segment ID or omitting this field signifies the document's body.

startIndex.title: Start Index
startIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

range.description: The range of content to delete. Deleting text across paragraph boundaries may merge paragraphs and affect styles. Certain deletions can invalidate document structure (e.g., part of a surrogate pair, last newline of critical elements, incomplete deletion of tables/equations).

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document from which to delete content. This ID can be found in the URL of the Google Doc.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_DIMENSION
tools.description: Tool to delete specified rows or columns from a sheet in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove a range of rows or columns.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet.

response_ranges.title: Response Ranges
response_ranges.description: Limits the ranges of cells included in the response spreadsheet.

delete_dimension_request.title: Delete Dimension Request

range.title: Range

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet from which to delete the dimension.

end_index.title: End Index
end_index.description: The zero-based end index of the range to delete, exclusive. The end index must be greater than the start index.

start_index.title: Start Index
start_index.description: The zero-based start index of the range to delete, inclusive. The start index must be less than the end index.

range.description: The range of the dimension to delete.

delete_dimension_request.description: The details for the delete dimension request object.

response_include_grid_data.title: Response Include Grid Data
response_include_grid_data.description: True if grid data should be returned. This parameter is ignored if a field mask was set in the request.

include_spreadsheet_in_response.title: Include Spreadsheet In Response
include_spreadsheet_in_response.description: Determines if the update response should include the spreadsheet resource.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_DRAFT
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific Gmail draft using its ID; ensure the draft exists and the user has necessary permissions for the given `user_id`.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user; 'me' is recommended.

draft_id.title: Draft Id
draft_id.description: Immutable ID of the draft to delete, typically obtained when the draft was created.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_DRIVE
tools.description: Tool to permanently delete a shared drive. Use when you need to remove a shared drive and its contents (if specified).

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive.

allowItemDeletion.title: Allow Item Deletion
allowItemDeletion.description: Whether any items inside the shared drive should also be deleted. This option is only supported when `useDomainAdminAccess` is also set to `true`.

useDomainAdminAccess.title: Use Domain Admin Access
useDomainAdminAccess.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then the requester will be granted access if they are an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_EVENT
tools.description: Deletes a specified event by `event_id` from a Google Calendar (`calendar_id`); this action is idempotent and raises a 404 error if the event is not found.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: Unique identifier of the event to delete, typically obtained upon event creation.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar (e.g., email address, specific ID, or 'primary' for the authenticated user's main calendar) from which the event will be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_FOOTER
tools.description: Tool to delete a footer from a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a footer from a specific section or the default footer.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The tab that contains the footer to delete. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

footer_id.title: Footer Id
footer_id.description: The ID of the footer to delete. If this footer is defined on DocumentStyle, the reference to this footer is removed, resulting in no footer of that type for the first section of the document. If this footer is defined on a SectionStyle, the reference to this footer is removed and the footer of that type is now continued from the previous section.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to delete the footer from.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_HEADER
tools.description: Deletes the header from the specified section or the default header if no section is specified. Use this tool to remove a header from a Google Document.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The tab containing the header to delete. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

header_id.title: Header Id
header_id.description: The ID of the header to delete. If this header is defined on `DocumentStyle`, the reference to this header is removed, resulting in no header of that type for the first section of the document. If this header is defined on a `SectionStyle`, the reference to this header is removed and the header of that type is now continued from the previous section.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document from which to delete the header.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_MESSAGE
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific email message by its ID from a Gmail mailbox; for `user_id`, use 'me' for the authenticated user or an email address to which the authenticated user has delegated access.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address. The special value 'me' refers to the authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Identifier of the email message to delete.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_NAMED_RANGE
tools.description: Tool to delete a named range from a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a previously defined named range by its ID or name.

deleteNamedRange.title: Delete Named Range

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the range(s) to delete. All named ranges with the given name will be deleted.

namedRangeId.title: Named Range Id
namedRangeId.description: The ID of the named range to delete.

tabsCriteria.title: TabsCriteria

tabIds.title: Tab Ids
tabIds.description: The list of tab IDs in which the request executes.

tabsCriteria.description: Optional. The criteria used to specify which tab(s) the range deletion should occur in. When omitted, the range deletion is applied to all tabs.

deleteNamedRange.description: Specifies the named range to delete.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_PARAGRAPH_BULLETS
tools.description: Tool to remove bullets from paragraphs within a specified range in a Google Document. Use when you need to clear bullet formatting from a section of a document.

range.title: Range

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The ID of the tab the range is in. If omitted, it applies to the first tab or the singular tab in a single-tab document.

endIndex.title: End Index
endIndex.description: The zero-based end index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the start of the segment.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer, or footnote the range is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

startIndex.title: Start Index
startIndex.description: The zero-based start index of the range, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the start of the segment.

range.description: The range of the document from which to delete paragraph bullets. The range is applied to the document body by default. To specify a different segment (e.g. header, footer), include segment_id in the range object.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The ID of the tab the range is in. If omitted, it applies to the first tab or the singular tab in a single-tab document.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_PERMISSION
tools.description: Deletes a permission from a file by permission ID. Use when you need to revoke access for a specific user or group from a file.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

useDomainAdminAccess.title: Use Domain Admin Access
useDomainAdminAccess.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then the requester will be granted access if the file ID parameter refers to a shared drive and the requester is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_REPLY
tools.description: Tool to delete a specific reply by reply ID. Use when you need to remove a reply from a comment on a file.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_SHEET
tools.description: Tool to delete a sheet (worksheet) from a spreadsheet. Use when you need to remove a specific sheet from a Google Sheet document.

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet to delete. If the sheet is of DATA_SOURCE type, the associated DataSource is also deleted.

spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet from which to delete the sheet.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_TABLE
tools.description: Tool to delete an entire table from a Google Document. Use when you have the document ID and the specific start and end index of the table element to be removed. The table's range can be found by inspecting the document's content structure.

tab_id.title: Tab Id
tab_id.description: The ID of the tab containing the table, if the document uses tabs. If omitted, the action applies to the first tab or the only tab.

segment_id.title: Segment Id
segment_id.description: The ID of the segment (e.g., header, footer) containing the table. If omitted or empty, the table is assumed to be in the main document body.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the Google Document from which the table will be deleted.

table_end_index.title: Table End Index
table_end_index.description: The end index (UTF-16 code unit) of the table's range to be deleted.

table_start_index.title: Table Start Index
table_start_index.description: The start index (UTF-16 code unit) of the table's range to be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_TABLE_COLUMN
tools.description: Tool to delete a column from a table in a Google Document. Use this tool when you need to remove a specific column from an existing table within a document.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index. For example, the second row in the table has a row index of 1.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index. For example, the second column in the table has a column index of 1.

tableStartLocation.title: Table Start Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The reference table cell location from which the column will be deleted.

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: A list of requests to be applied to the document.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to delete the table column from.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_TABLE_ROW
tools.description: Tool to delete a row from a table in a Google Document. Use when you need to remove a specific row from an existing table.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index. For example, the second row in the table has a row index of 1.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index. For example, the second column in the table has a column index of 1.

tableStartLocation.title: Table Start Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units. The index is relative to the beginning of the segment specified by segment_id.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The reference table cell location from which the row will be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_TASK
tools.description: Deletes a specified task from a given task list in Google Tasks.

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Task to be deleted.

tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id
tasklist_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Task list from which the task will be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DELETE_TASK_LIST
tools.description: Permanently deletes an existing Google Task list, identified by `tasklist_id`, along with all its tasks; this operation is irreversible.

tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id
tasklist_id.description: Unique identifier of the Google Task list to be deleted.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DISTANCE_MATRIX_API
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy API that calculates travel distance and time for a matrix of origins and destinations. This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). Use the modern 'Compute Route Matrix' action instead, which supports OAuth2 authentication. Supports different modes of transportation and options like departure/arrival times.

key.title: Key
key.description: Your application's API key. This key identifies your application for purposes of quota management.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Specifies the mode of transport to use.

avoid.title: Avoid
avoid.description: Indicates that the calculated route should avoid the specified features. Multiple values can be pipe-separated e.g. 'tolls|highways'.

units.title: Units
units.description: Specifies the unit system to use when displaying results. The default is metric.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region code, specified as a ccTLD ('top-level domain') two-character value. This helps influence results based on the region.

origins.title: Origins
origins.description: The starting point for calculating travel distance and time. You can supply one or more locations separated by the pipe character (|), in the form of a place ID (prefixed with place_id:), an address, latitude/longitude coordinates (e.g., '40.7128,-74.0060'), a plus code, or an encoded polyline (prefixed with enc: and a colon).

language.title: Language
language.description: The language in which to return results. See the list of supported languages: https://developers.google.com/maps/faq#languagesupport

arrival_time.title: Arrival Time
arrival_time.description: Specifies the desired time of arrival for transit directions, in seconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. You can specify either departure_time or arrival_time, but not both.

destinations.title: Destinations
destinations.description: One or more locations to use as the finishing point for calculating travel distance and time. Accepts the same formats as origins.

transit_mode.title: Transit Mode
transit_mode.description: Specifies one or more preferred modes of transit. This parameter may only be specified for transit directions. Multiple values can be pipe-separated e.g. 'bus|train'.

traffic_model.title: Traffic Model
traffic_model.description: Specifies the assumptions to use when calculating time in traffic. This parameter is only used if the request includes a departure_time and mode is 'driving'.

departure_time.title: Departure Time
departure_time.description: Specifies the desired time of departure. You can specify the time as an integer in seconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC, or as the string 'now'. Required for duration_in_traffic.

transit_routing_preference.title: Transit Routing Preference
transit_routing_preference.description: Specifies preferences for transit routes. This parameter may only be specified for transit directions.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DOWNLOAD_FILE
tools.description: Downloads a file from Google Drive by its ID. For Google Workspace documents (Docs, Sheets, Slides), optionally exports to a specified `mime_type`. For other file types, downloads in their native format regardless of mime_type. Examples: Export a Google Doc to plain text: {"file_id": "1N2o5xQWmAbCdEfGhIJKlmnOPq", "mime_type": "text/plain"} Download a Google Sheet as CSV: {"file_id": "1ZyXwVuTsRqPoNmLkJiHgFeDcB", "mime_type": "text/csv"}

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: The unique identifier of the file to be downloaded from Google Drive. This ID can typically be found in the file's URL in Google Drive or obtained from API calls that list files.

mime_type.title: MimeType
mime_type.description: Target MIME type for exporting Google Workspace documents (Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, Drawings). REQUIRED for Google Workspace files (will fail if omitted). Supported export formats vary by file type: - Google Docs: application/pdf, text/plain, text/html, application/rtf, application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document, application/epub+zip, text/markdown - Google Sheets: application/pdf, text/csv, application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet, application/zip (HTML) - Google Slides: application/pdf, application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation, text/plain For non-Google Workspace files (PDFs, images, videos, etc.), this parameter MUST be omitted or null; specifying a mime_type will cause an error.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_DUPLICATE_CALENDAR
tools.description: Creates a new, empty Google Calendar with the specified title (summary).

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Title for the new Google Calendar to be created. Required and must be a non-empty string.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EDIT_FILE
tools.description: Updates an existing Google Drive file by overwriting its entire content with new text (max 10MB). This action allows users to change the content of a Drive file, ensuring that the latest updates are saved and available without creating a new file. Users can specify different MIME types for the content being uploaded, facilitating various file formats.

content.title: Content
content.description: New textual content to overwrite the existing file; will be UTF-8 encoded for upload.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: Identifier of the Google Drive file to update.

mime_type.title: Mime Type
mime_type.description: MIME type of the 'content' being uploaded; must accurately represent its format.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EMPTY_TRASH
tools.description: Tool to permanently delete all of the user's trashed files. Use when you want to empty the trash in Google Drive. This action allows you to permanently remove all files that are currently in the trash of Google Drive. It can be applied to files in both the user's root trash and shared drives, ensuring a complete removal of unwanted files.

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: If set, empties the trash of the provided shared drive. This parameter is ignored if the item is not in a shared drive.

enforceSingleParent.title: Enforce Single Parent
enforceSingleParent.description: Deprecated: If an item is not in a shared drive and its last parent is deleted but the item itself is not, the item will be placed under its owner's root. This parameter is ignored if the item is not in a shared drive.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EVENTS_INSTANCES
tools.description: Returns instances of the specified recurring event.

timeMax.title: Time Max
timeMax.description: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by start time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

timeMin.title: Time Min
timeMin.description: Lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Optional. The default is not to filter by end time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Time zone used in the response. Optional. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Optional.

calendarId.title: Calendar Id
calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the `calendarList.list` method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

maxResults.title: Max Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of events returned on one result page. By default the value is 250 events. The page size can never be larger than 2500 events. Optional.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals "cancelled") in the result. Cancelled instances of recurring events will still be included if `singleEvents` is False. Optional. The default is False.

maxAttendees.title: Max Attendees
maxAttendees.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned. Optional.

originalStart.title: Original Start
originalStart.description: The original start time of the instance in the result. Optional.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EVENTS_LIST
tools.description: Returns events on the specified calendar.

q.title: Q
q.description: Free text search terms to find events that match these terms in various fields. Optional.

iCalUID.title: I Cal Uid
iCalUID.description: Specifies an event ID in the iCalendar format to be provided in the response. Optional. Use this if you want to search for an event by its iCalendar ID.

orderBy.title: Order By
orderBy.description: The order of the events returned in the result. Optional. The default is an unspecified, stable order. Acceptable values are: "startTime", "updated". When set to "startTime", singleEvents must be true. The action automatically sets singleEvents=true when orderBy='startTime'.

timeMax.title: Time Max
timeMax.description: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Optional. If unset, no start-time upper bound is applied. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset (e.g., 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00 or 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z). Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If timeMin is set, timeMax must be greater than timeMin.

timeMin.title: Time Min
timeMin.description: Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Optional. If unset, no end-time lower bound is applied. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset (e.g., 2011-06-03T10:00:00-07:00 or 2011-06-03T10:00:00Z). Milliseconds may be provided but are ignored. If timeMax is set, timeMin must be smaller than timeMax.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: Time zone used in the response. Optional. Use an IANA time zone identifier (e.g., America/Los_Angeles). Defaults to the user's primary time zone. Offsets (e.g., '-03:00', 'UTC+0') and abbreviations (e.g., 'IST', 'PST') are invalid.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Optional.

syncToken.title: Sync Token
syncToken.description: Token from nextSyncToken to return only entries changed since the last list. Cannot be combined with iCalUID, orderBy, privateExtendedProperty, q, sharedExtendedProperty, timeMin, timeMax, or updatedMin. Deletions since the previous list are always included; showDeleted cannot be false in this mode. The action automatically removes conflicting parameters when syncToken is provided.

calendarId.title: Calendar Id
calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

eventTypes.title: Event Types
eventTypes.description: Event types to return. Optional. This parameter can be repeated multiple times to return events of different types. If unset, returns all event types. Acceptable values are: "birthday", "default", "focusTime", "fromGmail", "outOfOffice", "workingLocation".

maxResults.title: Max Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of events returned on one result page. The number of events in the resulting page may be less than this value, or none at all, even if there are more events matching the query. Incomplete pages can be detected by a non-empty nextPageToken field in the response. By default the value is 250 events. The page size can never be larger than 2500 events. Optional.

updatedMin.title: Updated Min
updatedMin.description: Lower bound for an event's last modification time (RFC3339). When specified, entries deleted since this time are always included regardless of showDeleted. Optional.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Include cancelled events (status="cancelled"). Optional; default is false. This surfaces cancelled (soft-deleted) events, not items in the Trash. When syncToken or updatedMin is used, deletions since those markers are included regardless of showDeleted. Recurring interaction: if singleEvents=false and showDeleted=false, cancelled instances of a recurring series may still be included; if showDeleted=true and singleEvents=true, only single deleted instances (not parent series) are returned.

maxAttendees.title: Max Attendees
maxAttendees.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned. Optional. Must be >= 1 if provided.

singleEvents.title: Single Events
singleEvents.description: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events. Optional. The default is False.

showHiddenInvitations.title: Show Hidden Invitations
showHiddenInvitations.description: Whether to include hidden invitations in the result. Optional. The default is False. Hidden invitations are events where your attendee entry has responseStatus='needsAction' and attendees[].self==true. When true, such invitations are included.

sharedExtendedProperty.title: Shared Extended Property
sharedExtendedProperty.description: Extended properties constraint specified as propertyName=value. Matches only shared properties. This parameter might be repeated multiple times to return events that match all given constraints.

privateExtendedProperty.title: Private Extended Property
privateExtendedProperty.description: Extended properties constraint specified as propertyName=value. Matches only private properties. This parameter might be repeated multiple times to return events that match all given constraints.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EVENTS_MOVE
tools.description: Moves an event to another calendar, i.e., changes an event's organizer.

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: Event identifier. To retrieve event identifiers call the events.list method.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier of the source calendar. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: Calendar identifier of the destination calendar. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

send_updates.title: Send Updates
send_updates.description: Guests who should receive notifications about the change of the event's organizer. Acceptable values are: "all": Notifications are sent to all guests. "externalOnly": Notifications are sent to non-Google Calendar guests only. "none": No notifications are sent. This is the default value if left unspecified.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EVENTS_WATCH
tools.description: Watch for changes to Events resources.

id.title: Id
id.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

token.title: Token
token.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

params.title: EventsWatchRequestParams

ttl.title: Ttl
ttl.description: Time To Live for the notification channel.

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

payload.title: Payload
payload.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional.

calendarId.title: Calendar Id
calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_EXECUTE_SQL
tools.description: Execute SQL queries against Google Sheets tables. Supports SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations with familiar SQL syntax. Tables are automatically detected and mapped from the spreadsheet structure.

sql.title: Sql
examples: UPDATE "Inventory" SET quantity = quantity - 10 WHERE sku = 'ABC123'
sql.description: SQL query to execute. Supports SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE operations.

dry_run.title: Dry Run
dry_run.description: Preview changes without applying them (for write operations)

delete_method.title: Delete Method
delete_method.description: For DELETE operations: 'clear' preserves row structure, 'remove_rows' shifts data up

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: Google Sheets ID

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FETCH_EMAILS
tools.description: Fetches a list of email messages from a Gmail account, supporting filtering, pagination, and optional full content retrieval.

query.title: Query
query.description: Gmail advanced search query (e.g., 'from:user subject:meeting'). Supports operators like 'from:', 'to:', 'subject:', 'label:', 'has:attachment', 'is:unread', 'after:YYYY/MM/DD', 'before:YYYY/MM/DD', AND/OR/NOT. Use quotes for exact phrases. Omit for no query filter.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

verbose.title: Verbose
verbose.description: If false, uses optimized concurrent metadata fetching for faster performance (~75% improvement). If true, uses standard detailed message fetching. When false, only essential fields (subject, sender, recipient, time, labels) are guaranteed.

ids_only.title: Ids Only
ids_only.description: If true, only returns message IDs from the list API without fetching individual message details. Fastest option for getting just message IDs and thread IDs.

label_ids.title: Label Ids
label_ids.description: Filter by label IDs; only messages with all specified labels are returned. Common IDs: 'INBOX', 'SPAM', 'TRASH', 'UNREAD', 'STARRED', 'IMPORTANT', 'CATEGORY_PRIMARY' (alias 'CATEGORY_PERSONAL'), 'CATEGORY_SOCIAL', 'CATEGORY_PROMOTIONS', 'CATEGORY_UPDATES', 'CATEGORY_FORUMS'. Use 'listLabels' action for custom IDs.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token for retrieving a specific page, obtained from a previous response's `nextPageToken`. Omit for the first page.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of messages to retrieve per page.

include_payload.title: Include Payload
include_payload.description: Set to true to include full message payload (headers, body, attachments); false for metadata only.

include_spam_trash.title: Include Spam Trash
include_spam_trash.description: Set to true to include messages from 'SPAM' and 'TRASH'.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_MESSAGE_ID
tools.description: Fetches a specific email message by its ID, provided the `message_id` exists and is accessible to the authenticated `user_id`.

format.title: Format
format.description: Format for message content: 'minimal' (ID/labels), 'full' (complete data), 'raw' (base64url string), 'metadata' (ID/labels/headers).

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Unique ID of the email message to retrieve, obtainable from actions like 'List Messages'.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FETCH_MESSAGE_BY_THREAD_ID
tools.description: Retrieves messages from a Gmail thread using its `thread_id`, where the thread must be accessible by the specified `user_id`.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The email address of the user.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: Unique ID of the thread, obtainable from actions like 'listThreads' or 'fetchEmails'.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Opaque page token for fetching a specific page of messages if results are paginated.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FILES_MODIFY_LABELS
tools.description: Modifies the set of labels applied to a file. Returns a list of the labels that were added or modified. Use when you need to programmatically change labels on a Google Drive file, such as adding, updating, or removing them.

label_id.title: Label Id
label_id.description: The ID of the label to modify.

remove_label.title: Remove Label
remove_label.description: If true, the label will be removed from the file.

field_id.title: Field Id
field_id.description: The ID of the field to be modified.

unset_values.title: Unset Values
unset_values.description: Unsets the values for this field.

set_date_values.title: Set Date Values
set_date_values.description: Replaces the value of a `date` field with these new values. The string must be in the RFC 3339 full-date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

set_text_values.title: Set Text Values
set_text_values.description: Sets the value of a `text` field.

set_user_values.title: Set User Values
set_user_values.description: Replaces a `user` field with these new values. The values must be valid email addresses.

set_integer_values.title: Set Integer Values
set_integer_values.description: Replaces the value of an `integer` field with these new values.

set_selection_values.title: Set Selection Values
set_selection_values.description: Replaces a `selection` field with these new values.

field_modifications.title: Field Modifications
field_modifications.description: The list of modifications to this label's fields.

label_modifications.title: Label Modifications
label_modifications.description: The list of modifications to apply to the labels on the file.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FIND_EVENT
tools.description: Finds events in a specified Google Calendar using text query, time ranges (event start/end, last modification), and event types; ensure `timeMin` is not chronologically after `timeMax` if both are provided.

query.title: Query
query.description: Free-text search terms to find events. This query is matched against various event fields including summary, description, location, attendees' details (displayName, email), and organizer's details.

timeMax.title: Time Max
timeMax.description:
Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. Only events starting before this time are included. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00')

timeMin.title: Time Min
timeMin.description:
Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. Only events ending after this time are included. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00')

order_by.title: Order By
order_by.description: Order of events: 'startTime' (ascending by start time) or 'updated' (ascending by last modification time). Note: 'startTime' requires single_events=true. Use 'updated' if you need to include recurring masters (e.g., cancelled series).

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token from a previous response's `nextPageToken` to fetch the subsequent page of results.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to query. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the authenticated user, an email address for a specific user's calendar, or a calendar ID for other calendars.

items.title: EventType
items.description:
Event type constraints:
- 'birthday': Requires transparency='transparent', description must be omitted
- 'outOfOffice': Requires calendar_id='primary', Workspace/enterprise calendar,
  transparency='opaque', location and attendees must be omitted,
  create_meeting_room must be false
- 'focusTime': Requires Google Workspace Enterprise account with Focus Time feature enabled
- 'workingLocation': Requires Google Workspace Enterprise account

event_types.title: Event Types
event_types.description: Event types to include. Supported values: 'birthday', 'default', 'focusTime', 'outOfOffice', 'workingLocation'.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of events per page (1-2500).

updated_min.title: Updated Min
updated_min.description:
Lower bound (exclusive) for an event's last modification time to filter by. Only events updated after this time are included. When specified, events deleted since this time are also included, regardless of the `show_deleted` parameter. Accepts multiple formats:
1. RFC3339 timestamp (e.g., '2024-12-06T13:00:00Z')
2. Comma-separated date/time parts (e.g., '2024,12,06,13,00,00')
3. Simple datetime string (e.g., '2024-12-06 13:00:00')

show_deleted.title: Show Deleted
show_deleted.description: Include events whose status is 'cancelled'. This surfaces cancelled/deleted events, not a separate 'trash' view. Behavior with recurring events: when single_events=true, only individual cancelled instances are returned (the recurring master is omitted); to include cancelled recurring masters, set single_events=false. If updated_min is provided, events deleted since that time are included regardless of this flag.

single_events.title: Single Events
single_events.description: When true, recurring event series are expanded into their individual instances. When false, only the recurring master events are returned. Note: Ordering by 'startTime' requires singleEvents=true. For large calendars, it is strongly recommended to specify both timeMin and timeMax to limit the expansion window and improve performance.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FIND_FILE
tools.description: The comprehensive Google Drive search tool that handles all file and folder discovery needs. Use this for any file finding task - from simple name searches to complex queries with date filters, MIME types, permissions, custom properties, folder scoping, and more. Searches across My Drive and shared drives with full metadata support. Examples: - Find PDFs: q="mimeType = 'application/pdf'" - Find recent files: q="modifiedTime > '2024-01-01T00:00:00'" - Search by name: q="name contains 'report'" - Files in folder: folderId="abc123" or q="'FOLDER_ID' in parents"

q.title: Q
examples: name contains 'report' and not name contains 'draft'
name contains 'invoice' and modifiedTime > '2024-01-01T00:00:00' and trashed = false
q.description:
Query string to filter file results. Syntax: 'field operator value' combined with 'and', 'or', 'not'.

        **Operators:** =, !=, <, >, <=, >=, contains, in

        **Common Fields:**
        - `name`, `fullText` - File name or content
        - `mimeType` - File type (e.g., 'application/pdf', 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder')
        - `modifiedTime`, `createdTime` - Dates (RFC 3339: '2024-01-01T00:00:00')
        - `trashed`, `starred`, `sharedWithMe` - Boolean flags
        - `parents` - Folder IDs containing the file
        - `owners`, `writers` - User email addresses
        - `properties`, `appProperties` - Custom metadata

        **Special Syntax:**
        - Dates: RFC 3339 format (time zone defaults to UTC)
        - Escaping: Use backslash for special chars: "name contains 'owner\'s file'"
        - Grouping: Use parentheses for OR: "(mimeType contains 'image/' or mimeType contains 'video/')"
        - Custom properties: "properties has { key='department' and value='sales' }"
        
        **Common Use Cases:**
        - Find files modified after timestamp: "modifiedTime > '2024-10-01T14:30:00'"
        - Search file content: "fullText contains 'quarterly results'"

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. Use '*' for all fields or a comma-separated list, e.g., 'nextPageToken,files(id,name,mimeType)'.

spaces.title: Spaces
spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query. Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder' and 'photos'.

corpora.title: Corpora
corpora.description:
Specifies which collections of files to search. Defaults to 'allDrives' (searches My Drive + all accessible shared drives).

        **Values:**
        - `user` - Search only user's personal My Drive
        - `domain` - Search all files shared within Google Workspace domain
        - `drive` - Search specific shared drive (requires 'driveId' parameter and 'includeItemsFromAllDrives' must be true)
        - `allDrives` - Search My Drive + all accessible shared drives (DEFAULT, requires 'includeItemsFromAllDrives' to be true)

        **When to Use:**
        - Personal files only: Use 'user'
        - Organization-wide: Use 'domain'
        - Specific shared drive: Use 'drive' with 'driveId'
        - Maximum coverage: Use 'allDrives' (auto-enables supportsAllDrives and includeItemsFromAllDrives)

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: ID of the shared drive to search. Required if 'corpora' is 'drive'.

orderBy.title: Order By
orderBy.description:
Comma-separated sort keys. Ascending by default; add 'desc' for descending. Cannot be used when query (q) contains fullText search terms.

        **Valid Keys:**
        - `createdTime`, `modifiedTime`, `modifiedByMeTime` - Dates
        - `viewedByMeTime`, `sharedWithMeTime` - Activity dates
        - `name`, `name_natural` - File name (natural: file1, file2, file10)
        - `folder` - Folder hierarchy
        - `quotaBytesUsed` - Storage size
        - `starred`, `recency` - Starred status, recent activity
        
        **Restriction:** Sorting is not supported when the query contains fullText searches (e.g., "fullText contains 'keyword'"). Omit orderBy when using fullText queries.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The maximum number of files to return per page.

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: ID of a specific folder to search within. This automatically adds "'folder_id' in parents" to the query. Can be combined with the 'q' parameter to further filter results within the folder.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page.

include_labels.title: Include Labels
include_labels.description: A comma-separated list of label IDs to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response for each file.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. If 'includeItemsFromAllDrives' is true, this must also be true.

includeItemsFromAllDrives.title: Include Items From All Drives
includeItemsFromAllDrives.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results. Must be true when corpora is 'drive' or 'allDrives'. If true, 'supportsAllDrives' should also be true.

include_permissions_for_view.title: Include Permissions For View
include_permissions_for_view.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Currently, only 'published' is supported, which includes permissions for files with published content.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FIND_FOLDER
tools.description: Tool to find a folder in Google Drive by its name and optionally a parent folder. Use when you need to locate a specific folder to perform further actions like creating files in it or listing its contents.

starred.title: Starred
starred.description: Set to true to search for folders that are starred, or false for those that are not.

name_exact.title: Name Exact
name_exact.description: The exact name of the folder to search for as a string. This search is case-sensitive. Do not pass numbers - convert to string if needed.

name_contains.title: Name Contains
name_contains.description: A substring to search for within folder names as a string. This search is case-insensitive.

modified_after.title: Modified After
modified_after.description: Search for folders modified after a specific date and time. The timestamp must be in RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2023-01-15T10:00:00Z' or '2023-01-15T10:00:00.000Z').

parent_folder_id.title: Parent Folder Id
parent_folder_id.description: The ID of the parent folder to search within. Only folders directly inside this parent folder will be returned. You can find parent folder IDs by first searching for the parent folder by name.

name_not_contains.title: Name Not Contains
name_not_contains.description: A substring to exclude from folder names as a string. Folders with names containing this substring will not be returned. This search is case-insensitive.

full_text_contains.title: Full Text Contains
full_text_contains.description: A string to search for within the full text content of files within folders (if applicable and supported by Drive for the folder type or its contents). This search is case-insensitive.

full_text_not_contains.title: Full Text Not Contains
full_text_not_contains.description: A string to exclude from the full text content of files within folders. This search is case-insensitive.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FIND_FREE_SLOTS
tools.description: Finds both free and busy time slots in Google Calendars for specified calendars within a defined time range (defaults to the current day UTC if `time_min`/`time_max` are omitted). Returns busy intervals enriched with event details and calculates free slots by finding gaps between busy periods; `time_min` must precede `time_max` if both are provided. This action retrieves free and busy time slots for the specified calendars over a given time period. It analyzes the busy intervals from the calendars and provides calculated free slots based on the gaps in the busy periods.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of calendar identifiers to query for free/busy information. Each item must be a valid calendar identifier: 'primary' for the user's main calendar, a user/calendar email (e.g., user@example.com), or a calendar ID ending with a Google Calendar domain (e.g., ...@group.calendar.google.com). Only calendars accessible to the authenticated account are allowed. All identifiers are validated; if any is invalid or not found, the action returns an error.

time_max.title: Time Max
time_max.description: End datetime for the query interval. Accepts ISO, comma-separated, or simple datetime formats. If provided without an explicit timezone, it is interpreted in the specified `timezone`. Maximum span between time_min and time_max is approximately 90 days per Google Calendar freeBusy API limit.

time_min.title: Time Min
time_min.description: Start datetime for the query interval. Accepts ISO, comma-separated, or simple datetime formats. If provided without an explicit timezone, it is interpreted in the specified `timezone`. Maximum span between time_min and time_max is approximately 90 days per Google Calendar freeBusy API limit.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: IANA timezone identifier (e.g., 'America/New_York', 'Europe/London'). Determines how naive `time_min`/`time_max` are interpreted and the timezone used in the response for `timeMin`, `timeMax`, busy periods, and calculated free slots.

group_expansion_max.title: Group Expansion Max
group_expansion_max.description: Maximum calendar identifiers to return for a single group; exceeding this causes an error. Max allowed: 100.

calendar_expansion_max.title: Calendar Expansion Max
calendar_expansion_max.description: Maximum calendars for which FreeBusy information is provided. Max allowed: 50.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FIND_REPLACE
tools.description: Tool to find and replace text in a Google Spreadsheet. Use when you need to fix formula errors, update values, or perform bulk text replacements across cells. Common use cases: - Fix #ERROR! cells by replacing with empty string or correct formula - Update old values with new ones across multiple cells - Fix formula references or patterns - Clean up data formatting issues

find.title: Find
find.description: The text to find. Can be a literal string or a regular expression pattern.

range.title: Range
range.description: The A1 notation range to search in. If not specified, searches the entire sheet(s).

sheetId.title: Sheet Id
sheetId.description: The ID of the sheet to search in. If not specified, searches all sheets.

allSheets.title: All Sheets
allSheets.description: Whether to search across all sheets in the spreadsheet.

matchCase.title: Match Case
matchCase.description: Whether the search should be case-sensitive.

replacement.title: Replacement
replacement.description: The text to replace the found instances with.

searchByRegex.title: Search By Regex
searchByRegex.description: Whether to treat the find text as a regular expression.

spreadsheetId.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheetId.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

matchEntireCell.title: Match Entire Cell
matchEntireCell.description: Whether to match only cells that contain the entire search term.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FIND_WORKSHEET_BY_TITLE
tools.description: Finds a worksheet by its exact, case-sensitive title within a Google Spreadsheet; returns a boolean indicating if found and the complete metadata of the entire spreadsheet, regardless of whether the target worksheet is found.

title.title: Title
title.description: The exact, case-sensitive title of the worksheet (tab name) to find.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The unique identifier of the Google Spreadsheet. This ID is part of the spreadsheet's URL.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_FORMAT_CELL
tools.description: Applies text and background cell formatting to a specified range in a Google Sheets worksheet.

inputSchema.title: FormatCellRequest

red.title: Red
red.description: Red component of the background color (0.0-1.0).

blue.title: Blue
blue.description: Blue component of the background color (0.0-1.0).

green.title: Green
green.description: Green component of the background color (0.0-1.0).

range.title: Range
range.description: OPTION 1: Cell range in A1 notation (RECOMMENDED). Examples: 'A1' (single cell), 'F9' (cell F9), 'A1:B5' (range). Provide EITHER this field OR all four index fields below, not both.

worksheet_id.title: Worksheet Id
worksheet_id.description: ID (sheetId) of the worksheet. Use `GOOGLESHEETS_GET_SPREADSHEET_INFO` to find this ID.

end_row_index.title: End Row Index
end_row_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based index of the row AFTER the last row (exclusive). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: Identifier of the Google Sheets spreadsheet.

start_row_index.title: Start Row Index
start_row_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based row index (row 1 = index 0, row 9 = index 8). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together.

end_column_index.title: End Column Index
end_column_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based index of the column AFTER the last column (exclusive). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together.

start_column_index.title: Start Column Index
start_column_index.description: OPTION 2: 0-based column index (A = 0, B = 1, F = 5). Required if 'range' is not provided. Must provide ALL four index fields together.

inputSchema.description:
Parameters for applying formatting to a cell range in a Google Sheet.

IMPORTANT: Specify the cell range in ONE of two ways:
1. Use 'range' field with A1 notation (RECOMMENDED): "F9", "A1:B5"
2. Use all four index fields manually: start_row_index, start_column_index, end_row_index, end_column_index

Do NOT provide both - the validator will reject mixed input.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_GEOCODING_API
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy API to convert addresses into geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) and vice versa (reverse geocoding), or get an address for a Place ID. This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). Consider using the modern Places API (Text Search or Nearby Search) for similar functionality with OAuth2 authentication.

key.title: Key
key.description: Your application's API key. If not provided, will be extracted from connection metadata.

bounds.title: Bounds
bounds.description: The bounding box of the viewport within which to bias geocode results more prominently (e.g., '34.172684,-118.604794|34.236144,-118.500938'). This parameter will only influence, not fully restrict, results.

latlng.title: Latlng
latlng.description: The latitude and longitude coordinates specifying the location for which you want the closest, human-readable address (e.g., '40.714224,-73.961452'). Provide for reverse geocoding.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region code, specified as a ccTLD ('top-level domain') two-character value. This parameter will only influence, not fully restrict, results from the geocoder.

address.title: Address
address.description: The street address or plus code that you want to geocode. Provide for geocoding (address to coordinates).

language.title: Language
language.description: The language in which to return results. If language is not supplied, the geocoder attempts to use the preferred language as specified in the Accept-Language header, or the native language of the domain from which the request is sent.

place_id.title: Place Id
place_id.description: The place ID of the place for which you wish to obtain the human-readable address. Provide for place ID geocoding.

components.title: Components
components.description: A components filter with elements separated by a pipe (|). E.g., 'postal_code:94043|country:US'. Used for geocoding, can be restrictive or biasing.

result_type.title: Result Type
result_type.description: A filter of one or more address types, separated by a pipe (|) (e.g., 'street_address|locality'). Used for reverse geocoding and place ID geocoding.

location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: A filter of one or more location types, separated by a pipe (|) (e.g., 'ROOFTOP|RANGE_INTERPOLATED'). Used for reverse geocoding and place ID geocoding.

extra_computations.title: Extra Computations
extra_computations.description: Use this parameter to specify additional features in the response. Can select multiple values.

Default 0 is UTC.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_GET_DIRECTION
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy API that fetches detailed directions between an origin and a destination, supporting intermediate waypoints and various travel modes. This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). Use the modern 'Get Route' action instead, which supports OAuth2 authentication.

inputSchema.title: GetDirectionRequest

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: The mode of transportation for which to calculate directions. Supported values are 'driving' (default), 'walking', 'bicycling', and 'transit'.

avoid.title: Avoid
avoid.description: Specifies features to avoid in the generated route. Multiple values can be combined using a pipe delimiter (e.g., 'tolls|highways'). Valid options include 'tolls', 'highways', and 'ferries'.

units.title: Units
units.description: The unit system for displaying distances. Supported values are 'metric' (kilometers and meters) and 'imperial' (miles and feet). Defaults to 'imperial'.

origin.title: Origin
origin.description: The starting point for the directions. This can be a textual address (e.g., '123 Main St, Los Angeles, CA'), a place name (e.g., 'Disneyland'), or latitude/longitude coordinates (e.g., '34.0522,-118.2437').

language.title: Language
language.description: The language code for returning results, e.g., 'en' for English, 'es' for Spanish. Defaults to 'en'.

waypoints.title: Waypoints
waypoints.description: A comma-separated string of intermediate locations (addresses, place names, or coordinates) to visit between the origin and destination.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: The ending point for the directions. This can be a textual address (e.g., '456 Park Ave, New York, NY'), a place name (e.g., 'Universal Studios Hollywood'), or latitude/longitude coordinates (e.g., '40.7128,-74.0060').

inputSchema.description: Parameters for requesting directions between specified locations.
