conferenceRecord_id.title: Conference Record Id
conferenceRecord_id.description: Unique identifier of the conference record.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_GOOGLE_DRIVE_DELETE_FOLDER_OR_FILE_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to delete a file or folder in Google Drive. Use when you need to permanently remove a specific file or folder using its ID. Note: This action is irreversible.

fileId.title: File Id
fileId.description: The ID of the file or folder to delete. This is a required field.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the application supports both My Drives and shared drives. If false or unspecified, the file is attempted to be deleted from the user's My Drive. If true, the item will be deleted from shared drives as well if necessary.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_HIDE_DRIVE
tools.description: Tool to hide a shared drive from the default view. Use when you want to remove a shared drive from the user's main Google Drive interface without deleting it.

drive_id.title: Drive Id
drive_id.description: The ID of the shared drive.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_DIMENSION
tools.description: Tool to insert new rows or columns into a sheet at a specified location. Use when you need to add empty rows or columns within an existing Google Sheet.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

response_ranges.title: Response Ranges
response_ranges.description: Limits the ranges of the spreadsheet to include in the response.

insert_dimension.title: Insert Dimension

sheet_id.title: Sheet Id
sheet_id.description: The ID of the sheet where the dimensions will be inserted.

dimension.title: Dimension
dimension.description: The dimension to insert. Valid values are "ROWS" or "COLUMNS".

end_index.title: End Index
end_index.description: The end index (0-based, exclusive) of the dimension range to insert. The number of rows/columns to insert is `endIndex - startIndex`.

start_index.title: Start Index
start_index.description: The start index (0-based) of the dimension range to insert. The inserted dimensions will be placed before this index.

inherit_from_before.title: Inherit From Before
inherit_from_before.description: If true, the new dimensions will inherit properties from the dimension before the startIndex. If false (default), they will inherit from the dimension at the startIndex. startIndex must be greater than 0 if inheritFromBefore is true.

insert_dimension.description: The details for the insert dimension request.

response_include_grid_data.title: Response Include Grid Data
response_include_grid_data.description: True if grid data should be included in the response (if includeSpreadsheetInResponse is true).

include_spreadsheet_in_response.title: Include Spreadsheet In Response
include_spreadsheet_in_response.description: True if the updated spreadsheet should be included in the response.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_INLINE_IMAGE
tools.description: Tool to insert an image from a given URI at a specified location in a Google Document as an inline image. Use when you need to add an image to a document programmatically.

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: The URI of the image. Must be a publicly accessible direct image URL (no redirects or viewer links like Google Drive preview pages). Images must be less than 50MB, not exceed 25 megapixels, and be in PNG, JPEG, or GIF format (SVG not supported). The URI can be at most 2 kB in length.

location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index within the segment where the image will be inserted (required). Use 1 to insert at the beginning of the document body, or a higher number to insert at a specific position.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the segment where the image will be inserted. If not provided, the image is inserted in the document body.

location.description: The location in the document to insert the image. The index field is required to specify the insertion point.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

objectSize.title: ObjectSize

unit.title: UnitEnum
unit.description: The units for magnitude. Supported units: EMU, PT (PX is not supported by the API).

unit.title: UnitEnum
unit.description: The units for magnitude. Supported units: EMU, PT (PX is not supported by the API).

objectSize.description: The size of the image. If not specified, the image is rendered at its intrinsic size.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_PAGE_BREAK
tools.description: Tool to insert a page break into a Google Document. Use when you need to start new content on a fresh page, such as at the end of a chapter or section.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

insertPageBreak.title: Insert Page Break

location.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units. The page break is inserted before this index.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the segment where the page break is to be inserted. For page breaks, this should typically be null or empty, indicating the main document body, as page breaks are not allowed in headers, footers, or footnotes.

location.description: Specifies the location to insert the page break using a zero-based index. Use this or end_of_segment_location.

endOfSegmentLocation.title: EndOfSegmentLocation

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the segment where the page break is to be inserted. For page breaks, this must be null or an empty string, indicating the end of the main document body.

endOfSegmentLocation.description: Specifies that the page break should be inserted at the end of a segment (document body). Use this or location.

insertPageBreak.description: The details for the insertPageBreak request.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_TABLE_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to insert a table into a Google Document. Use when you need to add a new table at a specific location or at the end of a segment (like document body, header, or footer) in a document.

rows.title: Rows
rows.description: The number of rows in the table.

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index where the table will be inserted. If provided, 'location' will be used. If omitted and 'insertAtEndOfSegment' is false or omitted, 'endOfSegmentLocation' will be used for the document body.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

columns.title: Columns
columns.description: The number of columns in the table.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

documentId.title: Document Id
documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

insertAtEndOfSegment.title: Insert At End Of Segment
insertAtEndOfSegment.description: If true, inserts the table at the end of the segment (document body, header, or footer specified by segment_id). If false or omitted, and 'index' is not provided, it defaults to inserting at the end of the document body. If 'index' is provided, this field is ignored.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_TABLE_COLUMN
tools.description: Tool to insert a new column into a table in a Google Document. Use this tool when you need to add a column to an existing table at a specific location.

insertRight.title: Insert Right
insertRight.description: Whether to insert new column to the right of the reference cell location. True: insert to the right. False: insert to the left.

tableCellLocation.title: Table Cell Location

rowIndex.title: Row Index
rowIndex.description: The zero-based row index of the reference cell.

columnIndex.title: Column Index
columnIndex.description: The zero-based column index of the reference cell.

tableStartLocation.title: Location

index.title: Index
index.description: The zero-based index, in UTF-16 code units, relative to the beginning of the segment.

tabId.title: Tab Id
tabId.description: The tab that the location is in. When omitted, the request is applied to the first tab.

segmentId.title: Segment Id
segmentId.description: The ID of the header, footer or footnote the location is in. An empty segment ID signifies the document's body.

tableStartLocation.description: The location where the table starts in the document.

tableCellLocation.description: The reference table cell location from which columns will be inserted.

requests.title: Requests
requests.description: A list of requests to be applied to the document. For this action, it will contain one InsertTableColumnRequest.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to update.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_TASK
tools.description: Creates a new task in a given `tasklist_id`, optionally as a subtask of an existing `task_parent` or positioned after an existing `task_previous` sibling, where both `task_parent` and `task_previous` must belong to the same `tasklist_id` if specified. IMPORTANT: Date fields (due, completed) accept various formats like '28 Sep 2025', '11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025', or ISO format '2025-09-21T15:30:00Z' and will automatically convert them to RFC3339 format required by the API.

inputSchema.title: InsertTaskRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for the task. Generated by Google Tasks API when creating a task. Used for updating or deleting existing tasks.

due.title: Due
due.description:
Due date for the task (optional). NOTE: Google Tasks only stores the date portion - any time provided will be normalized to midnight UTC by the API. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

etag.title: Etag
etag.description: ETag of the resource for concurrency control. Prevents accidental overwrites when multiple clients modify the same task. Auto-generated by the API.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Additional details or description for the task. Supports plain text only (no HTML/markdown). Maximum 8192 characters. Example: 'Include Q3 sales data and projections'

title.title: Title
title.description: Title/name of the task (REQUIRED). This is the main text displayed for the task. Maximum 1024 characters. Example: 'Complete quarterly report'

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: Whether the task is hidden from the default view. Hidden tasks can still be accessed via API but won't show in UI. Default: false

status.title: Status
status.description: Current status of the task (REQUIRED). Must be either 'needsAction' (task is pending) or 'completed' (task is done). Default: 'needsAction'

deleted.title: Deleted
deleted.description: Whether the task has been deleted. Deleted tasks are marked but not immediately removed, allowing for recovery. Default: false

completed.title: Completed
completed.description:
Date/time when the task was marked as completed. Only applicable when status='completed'. Unlike 'due', this field preserves the time component. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

task_parent.title: Task Parent
task_parent.description: Identifier of an existing task to serve as parent; if provided, creates a subtask, otherwise a top-level task in the specified list.

tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id
tasklist_id.description: Identifier for the Google Task list where the new task will be created. Use actual task list IDs, not '@default'. You can get list IDs using 'List Task Lists' action.

task_previous.title: Task Previous
task_previous.description: Identifier of an existing task after which the new task will be placed, at the same hierarchical level (as a sibling).

inputSchema.description:
Defines the request for creating a new task. Inherits common task properties
(e.g., title, notes, due date) from `TaskInput` and adds specific parameters
for task placement within a Google Tasks list.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_INSERT_TEXT_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to insert a string of text at a specified location within a Google Document. Use when you need to add new text content to an existing document.

document_id.title: Document Id
document_id.description: The ID of the document to insert text into.

text_to_insert.title: Text To Insert
text_to_insert.description: The string of text to insert.

insertion_index.title: Insertion Index
insertion_index.description: The EOL character of the paragraph will be moved to the end of the inserted text. The index where the text will be inserted. The index is zero-based and refers to the UTF-16 code unit. For example, to insert text at the beginning of the document, use an index of 1 (to account for the first paragraph).

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_ACCOUNTS
tools.description: Tool to list all Accounts accessible by the caller. Use when you need to enumerate all Google Analytics accounts your credentials can access.

inputSchema.title: ListAccountsRequest

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of accounts to return. Must be ≥1.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Optional. Whether to include soft-deleted (trashed) Accounts.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Accounts.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_ACL_RULES
tools.description: Retrieves the list of access control rules (ACLs) for a specified calendar, providing the necessary 'rule_id' values required for updating specific ACL rules.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token specifying which result page to return. Optional.

sync_token.title: Sync Token
sync_token.description: Token obtained from the nextSyncToken field returned on the last page of a previous list operation. It makes the result of this list operation contain only entries that have changed since then. Optional. The default is to retrieve all entries.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of entries returned on one result page. Optional. The default is 100.

show_deleted.title: Show Deleted
show_deleted.description: Whether to include deleted ACLs in the result. Optional. The default is False.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_ALBUMS
tools.description: Lists all albums shown to a user in the Albums tab of Google Photos.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Maximum number of albums to return. Default 20, maximum 50.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Continuation token for getting the next page of results

excludeNonAppCreatedData.title: Exclude Non App Created Data
excludeNonAppCreatedData.description: If true, excludes media items not created by this app

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_AUDIENCE_EXPORTS
tools.description: Tool to list all audience exports for a GA4 property. Use when you need to fetch its export history after initiating exports.

inputSchema.title: ListAudienceExportsRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the parent property. Format: properties/{property_id}

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 200; larger values are coerced to 1000.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results; other parameters must match original call when paginating.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing AudienceExports under a GA4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_AUDIENCE_LISTS
tools.description: Tool to list all audience lists for a GA4 property. Use when you need to retrieve a property's configured audience lists after confirming the property ID.

inputSchema.title: ListAudienceListsRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the parent property. Format: properties/{property_id}

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of audience lists to return. Defaults to 200; maximum is 1000.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing AudienceLists under a GA4 property.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_AUDIENCES
tools.description: Tool to list all audiences on a property. Use when you need to fetch all audiences for a GA4 property after confirming its existence.

inputSchema.title: ListAudiencesRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Property ID or full resource name. Accepts: '123456789' or 'properties/123456789'

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of Audiences to return.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Audiences under a property.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_CALENDARS
tools.description: Retrieves a paginated list of calendars from the user's calendar list, with optional filtering and sync capabilities.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token for retrieving a specific page of results from a previous list operation.

syncToken.title: Sync Token
syncToken.description: Sync token from a previous list request's 'nextSyncToken' to retrieve only entries changed since the last sync. When provided, only 'syncToken' and optionally 'pageToken' are used; other filters are ignored. 'minAccessRole' cannot be combined with 'syncToken'.

maxResults.title: Max Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of calendars to return per page. Maximum allowed value is 250.

showHidden.title: Show Hidden
showHidden.description: Include calendars hidden in the user interface. When using 'syncToken', hidden (and deleted) entries changed since the previous list are always included, and this parameter must not be set to false.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Include calendar list entries deleted from the user's list. Deleted entries are returned with the 'deleted' field set to true. When using 'syncToken', deleted (and hidden) entries changed since the previous list are always included, and this parameter must not be set to false.

minAccessRole.title: AccessRole
minAccessRole.description: Minimum access role the user must have for the returned calendars.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_CHANGES
tools.description: Tool to list the changes for a user or shared drive. Use when you need to track modifications to files and folders, such as creations, deletions, or permission changes. This action requires a `pageToken` which can be initially obtained using the `get_changes_start_page_token` action or from a previous `LIST_CHANGES` response. Example usage: ```json { "pageSize": 100, "includeRemoved": true } ``` Returns changes with timestamps, file IDs, and modification details. Save the `newStartPageToken` from the response to monitor future changes efficiently.

spaces.title: Spaces
spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpora. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'.

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: The shared drive from which changes will be returned. If specified the change IDs will be reflective of the shared drive; use the combined drive ID and change ID as an identifier.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The maximum number of changes to return per page.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response or to the response from the getStartPageToken method.

includeLabels.title: Include Labels
includeLabels.description: A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response.

includeRemoved.title: Include Removed
includeRemoved.description: Whether to include changes indicating that items have been removed from the list of changes, for example by deletion or loss of access.

restrictToMyDrive.title: Restrict To My Drive
restrictToMyDrive.description: Whether to restrict the results to changes inside the My Drive hierarchy. This omits changes to files such as those in the Application Data folder or shared files which have not been added to My Drive.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives.

includeCorpusRemovals.title: Include Corpus Removals
includeCorpusRemovals.description: Whether changes should include the file resource if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request, even when a file was removed from the list of changes and there will be no further change entries for this file.

includeItemsFromAllDrives.title: Include Items From All Drives
includeItemsFromAllDrives.description: Whether both My Drive and shared drive items should be included in results.

includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View
includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_COMMENTS
tools.description: Tool to list all comments for a file in Google Drive. Use when you need to retrieve comments associated with a specific file.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response. Use `*` to include all fields.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The maximum number of comments to return per page.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

includeDeleted.title: Include Deleted
includeDeleted.description: Whether to include deleted comments. Deleted comments will not include their original content.

startModifiedTime.title: Start Modified Time
startModifiedTime.description: The minimum value of 'modifiedTime' for the result comments (RFC 3339 date-time).

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_CONFERENCE_RECORDS
tools.description: Tool to list conference records. Use when you need to retrieve a list of past conferences, optionally filtering them by criteria like meeting code, space name, or time range.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Optional. User specified filtering condition in EBNF format. Filterable fields: `space.meeting_code`, `space.name`, `start_time`, `end_time`. Examples: `space.name = "spaces/NAME"`, `space.meeting_code = "abc-mnop-xyz"`, `start_time>="2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" AND start_time<="2024-01-02T00:00:00.000Z"`, `end_time IS NULL`

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Maximum number of conference records to return. The service might return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 25 conference records are returned. The maximum value is 100; values above 100 are coerced to 100.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Page token returned from previous List Call.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_DRAFTS
tools.description: Retrieves a paginated list of email drafts from a user's Gmail account. Use verbose=true to get full draft details including subject, body, sender, and timestamp.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's mailbox ID; use 'me' for the authenticated user.

verbose.title: Verbose
verbose.description: If true, fetches full draft details including subject, sender, recipient, body, and timestamp. If false, returns only draft IDs (faster).

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token from a previous response to retrieve a specific page of drafts.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of drafts to return per page.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_FILE_LABELS
tools.description: Tool to list the labels on a file. Use when you need to retrieve all labels associated with a specific file in Google Drive.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of results.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: The maximum number of labels to return per page. Default is 100.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_FILES
tools.description: Tool to list a user's files and folders in Google Drive. Use this to search or browse for files and folders based on various criteria.

q.title: Q
q.description: A query string for filtering the file results. Supports operators like 'and', 'or', 'not', and can filter on fields like 'name', 'mimeType', 'modifiedTime', 'starred', 'trashed'. Example: "name contains 'important' and mimeType = 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'".

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. This can be used to retrieve only specific file metadata, improving performance. Example: 'nextPageToken, files(id, name, mimeType, modifiedTime)'

spaces.title: Spaces
spaces.description: A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the corpora. Supported values are 'drive' and 'appDataFolder'. 'drive' represents files in My Drive and shared drives, while 'appDataFolder' represents the application's private data folder.

corpora.title: Corpora
corpora.description: Specifies the bodies of items (files/documents) to which the query applies. Supported values are 'user', 'domain', 'drive', and 'allDrives'. It's generally more efficient to use 'user' or 'drive' instead of 'allDrives'. Defaults to 'user'.

driveId.title: Drive Id
driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive to search. This is used when `corpora` is set to 'drive'.

orderBy.title: Order By
orderBy.description: A comma-separated list of sort keys. Valid keys include 'createdTime', 'folder', 'modifiedByMeTime', 'modifiedTime', 'name', 'name_natural', 'quotaBytesUsed', 'recency', 'sharedWithMeTime', 'starred', 'viewedByMeTime'. Each key sorts in ascending order by default, but can be reversed with the 'desc' modifier (e.g., 'modifiedTime desc').

folderId.title: Folder Id
folderId.description: ID of a specific folder to list files from. This is a convenience parameter that automatically adds "'folder_id' in parents" to the query. Cannot be used together with a custom 'q' parameter.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The maximum number of files to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 1000, inclusive. Defaults to 100.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

includeLabels.title: Include Labels
includeLabels.description: A comma-separated list of label IDs to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response for each file.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Defaults to false. If true, then `includeItemsFromAllDrives` can be used to extend the search to all drives.

includeItemsFromAllDrives.title: Include Items From All Drives
includeItemsFromAllDrives.description: Whether to include items from both My Drive and shared drives. This is relevant when `corpora` is 'user' or 'domain'. Defaults to false.

includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View
includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Currently, only 'published' is supported, which includes permissions for files with published content.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_HISTORY
tools.description: Tool to list Gmail mailbox change history since a known startHistoryId. Use when performing incremental mailbox syncs to fetch only new changes.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's email address. Use 'me' to specify the authenticated user.

label_id.title: Label Id
label_id.description: Only return history records involving messages with this label ID.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token to retrieve a specific page of results.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of history records to return. Default is 100; max is 500.

history_types.title: History Types
history_types.description: Filter by specific history types. Allowed values: messageAdded, messageDeleted, labelAdded, labelRemoved.

start_history_id.title: Start History Id
start_history_id.description: Required. Returns history records after this ID. If the ID is invalid or too old, the API returns 404. Perform a full sync in that case.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_KEY_EVENTS
tools.description: Tool to list Key Events. Use when you need to retrieve all key event definitions for a given property.

inputSchema.title: ListKeyEventsRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the parent property. Format: properties/{property_id}.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 200.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Key Events under a specified parent property.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_LABELS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of all system and user-created labels for the specified Gmail account.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Identifies the Gmail account (owner's email or 'me' for authenticated user) for which labels will be listed.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_MEDIA_ITEMS
tools.description: Lists all media items from a user's Google Photos library.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Maximum number of items to return. Default 25, maximum 100.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token for getting the next page of results

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_PARTICIPANT_SESSIONS
tools.description: Tool to list all participant sessions for a specific conference record in Google Meet. Use this when you need to retrieve a list of participants who joined a particular meeting.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Optional. User-specified filtering condition in EBNF format. Filterable fields include `earliest_start_time` and `latest_end_time`.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. The identifier of the conference record, in the format `conferenceRecords/{conferenceRecord}`.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Optional. Maximum number of participants to return. The service might return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 100 participants are returned. The maximum value is 250; values above 250 are coerced to 250.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Optional. Page token returned from a previous list call, used to retrieve the next page of results.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_PERMISSIONS
tools.description: Tool to list a file's permissions. Use when you need to retrieve all permissions associated with a specific file or shared drive.

fileId.title: File Id
fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The maximum number of permissions to return per page. When not set for files in a shared drive, at most 100 results will be returned. When not set for files that are not in a shared drive, the entire list will be returned.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Default: false

useDomainAdminAccess.title: Use Domain Admin Access
useDomainAdminAccess.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator; if set to true, then theRequester will be granted access if the file ID parameter refers to a shared drive and the requester is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs.

includePermissionsForView.title: Include Permissions For View
includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_PROPERTIES
tools.description: Tool to list GA4 properties under a specific account. Use after obtaining an account ID; supports pagination and including soft-deleted properties.

inputSchema.title: ListPropertiesRequest

account.title: Account
account.description: Required. The account resource name. Format: accounts/{account_id}

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of properties to return; must be between 1 and 200.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token returned from a previous call to retrieve the next page of results.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Optional. Whether to include soft-deleted (trashed) properties.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing GA4 properties under an account.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_REPLIES_TO_COMMENT
tools.description: Tool to list replies to a comment in Google Drive. Use this when you need to retrieve all replies associated with a specific comment on a file.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response. Use '*' for all fields or e.g. 'replies(id,content),nextPageToken'

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: The maximum number of replies to return per page.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

include_deleted.title: Include Deleted
include_deleted.description: Whether to include deleted replies. Deleted replies will not include their original content.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_REPORTING_DATA_ANNOTATIONS
tools.description: Tool to list all Reporting Data Annotations on a property. Use when you need to retrieve or inspect annotations for a GA4 property.

inputSchema.title: ListReportingDataAnnotationsRequest

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Restricts which annotations are listed. Supported fields: name, title, description, annotationDate, annotationDateRange, color; operations: =, !=, <, >, <=, >=, :, =~, !~, NOT, AND, OR; helper functions: annotation_duration(), is_annotation_in_range(startDate,endDate).

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Resource name of the property. Format: properties/{property_id}.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of annotations to return. Defaults to 50, max 200.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing Reporting Data Annotations on a property.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_REVISIONS
tools.description: Tool to list a file's revisions. Use when you need to retrieve the revision history of a specific file in Google Drive.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The maximum number of revisions to return per page.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page. This should be set to the value of 'nextPageToken' from the previous response.

supportsAllDrives.title: Supports All Drives
supportsAllDrives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Defaults to false.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_ROLLUP_PROPERTIES
tools.description: Tool to list roll-up GA4 properties accessible to the caller. Use when you need to identify roll-up properties across all accessible accounts.

inputSchema.title: ListRollupPropertiesRequest

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of account summaries to return; must be between 1 and 200.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing roll-up GA4 properties accessible to the caller.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_SEARCH_ADS360_LINKS
tools.description: Tool to list all SearchAds360Links on a property. Use when you need to fetch all Search Ads 360 links for a given property after authenticating.

inputSchema.title: ListSearchAds360LinksRequest

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: Required. Resource name of the property. Format: properties/{propertyId} (e.g., properties/1234).

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Optional. Maximum number of results to return. Must be between 1 and 200. Defaults to 50.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Optional. Token for retrieving the next page of results.

inputSchema.description: Request model for listing SearchAds360Links for a Google Analytics property.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_SHARED_DRIVES
tools.description: Tool to list the user's shared drives. Use when you need to get a list of all shared drives accessible to the authenticated user.

q.title: Q
q.description: Query string for searching shared drives.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: Maximum number of shared drives to return per page.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Page token for shared drives.

useDomainAdminAccess.title: Use Domain Admin Access
useDomainAdminAccess.description: Issue the request as a domain administrator. If set to true, then all shared drives of the domain in which the requester is an administrator are returned.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_SPREADSHEET_CHARTS_ACTION
tools.description: Tool to retrieve a list of charts with their IDs and metadata from a Google Sheets spreadsheet. Use to identify charts available for embedding into Google Docs.

fields_mask.title: Fields Mask
fields_mask.description: Field mask to specify which parts of the spreadsheet and chart resources to include. Example: '''sheets(properties(sheetId,title),charts(chartId,spec(title,altText)))'''

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: The ID of the Google Sheets spreadsheet.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_TABLES
tools.description: This action is used to list all tables in a Google Spreadsheet, call this action to get the list of tables in a spreadsheet. Discover all tables in a Google Spreadsheet by analyzing sheet structure and detecting data patterns. Uses heuristic analysis to find header rows, data boundaries, and table structures.

min_rows.title: Min Rows
min_rows.description: Minimum number of data rows to consider a valid table

min_columns.title: Min Columns
min_columns.description: Minimum number of columns to consider a valid table

min_confidence.title: Min Confidence
min_confidence.description: Minimum confidence score (0.0-1.0) to consider a valid table

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: Google Sheets ID from the URL (e.g., '1BxiMVs0XRA5nFMdKvBdBZjgmUUqptlbs74OgvE2upms')

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_TASK_LISTS
tools.description: Fetches the authenticated user's task lists from Google Tasks; results may be paginated.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token for the page of results to return; omit for the first page, use `nextPageToken` from a previous response for subsequent pages.

maxResults.title: Max Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of task lists to return per page.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_TASKS
tools.description: Retrieves tasks from a Google Tasks list; all date/time strings must be RFC3339 UTC, and `showCompleted` must be true if `completedMin` or `completedMax` are specified.

dueMax.title: Due Max
dueMax.description:
Exclude tasks due after this date. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

dueMin.title: Due Min
dueMin.description:
Exclude tasks due before this date. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

pageToken.title: Page Token
pageToken.description: Token from a previous list operation for fetching a specific page; if omitted, retrieves the first page.

maxResults.title: Max Results
maxResults.description: Maximum number of tasks to return. API default: 20, maximum: 100.

showHidden.title: Show Hidden
showHidden.description: Include hidden tasks. Defaults to false.

updatedMin.title: Updated Min
updatedMin.description:
Lower bound for task's last modification time (for syncing). 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

showDeleted.title: Show Deleted
showDeleted.description: Include deleted tasks. Defaults to false.

tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id
tasklist_id.description: Identifier of the task list. Use '@default' for the user's primary task list.

completedMax.title: Completed Max
completedMax.description:
Exclude tasks completed after this date. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

completedMin.title: Completed Min
completedMin.description:
Exclude tasks completed before this date. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

showCompleted.title: Show Completed
showCompleted.description: Include completed tasks. Defaults to true. (See action docstring for interaction with `completedMin`/`Max`).

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LIST_THREADS
tools.description: Retrieves a list of email threads from a Gmail account, identified by `user_id` (email address or 'me'), supporting filtering and pagination.

query.title: Query
query.description: Filter for threads, using Gmail search query syntax (e.g., 'from:user@example.com is:unread').

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The user's email address or 'me' to specify the authenticated Gmail account.

verbose.title: Verbose
verbose.description: If false, returns threads with basic fields (id, snippet, historyId). If true, returns threads with complete message details including headers, body, attachments, and metadata for each message in the thread.

page_token.title: Page Token
page_token.description: Token from a previous response to retrieve a specific page of results; omit for the first page.

max_results.title: Max Results
max_results.description: Maximum number of threads to return.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_LOOKUP_SPREADSHEET_ROW
tools.description: Finds the first row in a Google Spreadsheet where a cell's entire content exactly matches the query string, searching within a specified A1 notation range or the first sheet by default.

query.title: Query
query.description: Exact text value to find; matches the entire content of a cell in a row.

range.title: Range
range.description: A1 notation range with explicit subrange (e.g., 'Sheet1!A1:D5', 'MySheet!A:Z'). Defaults to the first sheet if omitted. IMPORTANT: Sheet names with spaces must be single-quoted (e.g., "'My Sheet'!A1:Z"). Bare sheet names without ranges (e.g., 'Sheet1') are not supported - always specify a range.

case_sensitive.title: Case Sensitive
case_sensitive.description: If `True`, the query string search is case-sensitive.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: Identifier of the Google Spreadsheet to search.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_MAPS_EMBED_API
tools.description: Tool to generate an embeddable Google Map URL and HTML iframe code. Use when you need to display a map (place, view, directions, street view, search) on a webpage without JavaScript. Note: This API only works with API keys (no OAuth2 support). It generates embed URLs and does not make direct API calls.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: The mode of the embedded map.

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840'). This is REQUIRED for view mode.

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

q.title: Q
q.description: Defines the map marker location. Accepts a URL-escaped place name, address, plus code, or Place ID (prefixed with 'place_id:').

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

q.title: Q
q.description: Defines the search term. Can include a geographic restriction (e.g., 'record+stores+in+Seattle').

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

avoid.title: Avoid
avoid.description: Specifies features to avoid in directions (e.g., 'tolls', 'highways', 'ferries'). Separate multiple values with the pipe character (|). E.g. 'tolls|highways'.

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

origin.title: Origin
origin.description: Defines the starting point for directions. Accepts URL-escaped place name, address, plus code, lat/lng coordinates, or Place ID (prefixed with 'place_id:').

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

waypoints.title: Waypoints
waypoints.description: Specifies one or more intermediary places to route directions. Separate multiple waypoints with the pipe character (|). E.g., 'Berlin,Germany|Paris,France'. Up to 20 waypoints.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: Defines the endpoint of the directions. Accepts URL-escaped place name, address, plus code, lat/lng coordinates, or Place ID (prefixed with 'place_id:').

fov.title: Fov
fov.description: Horizontal field of view in degrees (10-100). Smaller numbers mean higher zoom.

pano.title: Pano
pano.description: A specific panorama ID. Required if 'location' is not provided. 'location' can be a fallback.

zoom.title: Zoom
zoom.description: Sets the initial zoom level of the map. Values range from 0 (the whole world) to 21 (individual buildings).

pitch.title: Pitch
pitch.description: Angle, up or down, of the camera in degrees (-90 to 90). Positive is up.

center.title: Center
center.description: Defines the center of the map view. Accepts comma-separated latitude and longitude value (e.g., '37.4218,-122.0840').

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: Radius in meters to search for a panorama, centered on lat/lng. Default 50.

region.title: Region
region.description: Defines appropriate borders and labels based on geopolitical sensitivities (e.g., 'US', 'GB'). Accepts a two-character ccTLD code.

source.title: Source
source.description: Limits Street View searches to selected sources. 'default' or 'outdoor'.

heading.title: Heading
heading.description: Compass heading of the camera in degrees clockwise from North (-180 to 360).

maptype.title: Maptype
maptype.description: Defines the type of map tiles to load.

language.title: Language
language.description: Defines the language for UI elements and map labels (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr').

location.title: Location
location.description: Latitude and longitude as comma-separated values (e.g., '46.414382,10.013988'). Displays panorama closest to this location. Required if 'pano' is not provided.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_MODIFY_THREAD_LABELS
tools.description: Adds or removes specified existing label IDs from a Gmail thread, affecting all its messages; ensure the thread ID is valid.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: Immutable ID of the thread to modify.

add_label_ids.title: Add Label Ids
add_label_ids.description: List of label IDs to add to the thread; these labels must exist.

remove_label_ids.title: Remove Label Ids
remove_label_ids.description: List of label IDs to remove from the thread; these labels must exist.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_MOVE_FILE
tools.description: Tool to move a file from one folder to another in Google Drive. Use when you need to reorganize files by changing their parent folder(s).

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: The ID of the file to move.

add_parents.title: Add Parents
add_parents.description: The ID of the parent folder to add the file to. Google Drive files can only have one parent folder.

ocr_language.title: Ocr Language
ocr_language.description: A language hint for OCR processing during image import (ISO 639-1 code).

include_labels.title: Include Labels
include_labels.description: A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in the `labelInfo` part of the response.

remove_parents.title: Remove Parents
remove_parents.description: A comma-separated list of parent folder IDs to remove the file from. Use this to specify the source folder.

supports_all_drives.title: Supports All Drives
supports_all_drives.description: Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives and shared drives. Set to true if moving files to or from a shared drive.

keep_revision_forever.title: Keep Revision Forever
keep_revision_forever.description: Whether to set the 'keepForever' field in the new head revision. This is only applicable to files with binary content in Google Drive.

include_permissions_for_view.title: Include Permissions For View
include_permissions_for_view.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported.

use_content_as_indexable_text.title: Use Content As Indexable Text
use_content_as_indexable_text.description: Whether to use the uploaded content as indexable text.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_MOVE_TASK
tools.description: Moves the specified task to another position in the destination task list.

parent.title: Parent
parent.description: New parent task identifier. If not provided, the task is moved to the top level.

previous.title: Previous
previous.description: New previous sibling task identifier. If not provided, the task is moved to the first position among its siblings.

destinationTasklist.title: Destination Tasklist
destinationTasklist.description: Destination task list identifier. If set, the task is moved to this list; otherwise, it remains in its current list.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_MOVE_TO_TRASH
tools.description: Moves an existing, non-deleted email message to the trash for the specified user.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: User's email address or 'me' for the authenticated user.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: Identifier of the email message to move to trash.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_NEARBY_SEARCH
tools.description: Searches for places (e.g., restaurants, parks) within a specified circular area, with options to filter by place types and customize the returned fields and number of results.

radius.title: Radius
radius.description: Radius of the circular search area in meters.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude coordinate of the search center in decimal degrees.

fieldMask.title: Field Mask
fieldMask.description: Comma-separated list of place fields for the response (e.g., 'places.displayName,places.formattedAddress'); use '*' for all fields.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude coordinate of the search center in decimal degrees.

excludedTypes.title: Excluded Types
excludedTypes.description: Place types to exclude (e.g., 'cafe', 'store'); results matching any of these types are omitted. For supported types, see Google Maps Places API documentation.

includedTypes.title: Included Types
includedTypes.description: Place types to include (e.g., 'restaurant', 'park'); results will match at least one of these types. For supported types, see Google Maps Places API documentation.

maxResultCount.title: Max Result Count
maxResultCount.description: Maximum number of search results to return (up to 20); the actual count may be lower.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_PARSE_FILE
tools.description: DEPRECATED: Exports Google Workspace files (max 10MB) to a specified format using `mime_type`, or downloads other file types; use `GOOGLEDRIVE_DOWNLOAD_FILE` instead.

file_id.title: File Id
file_id.description: The unique ID of the file stored in Google Drive that you want to export or download.

mime_type.title: MimeType
mime_type.description: Target MIME type for exporting Google Workspace documents (e.g., Docs, Sheets) to a different format (e.g., PDF, DOCX). Omit for direct download of non-Workspace files or if no conversion is needed for Workspace files.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_PATCH_CALENDAR
tools.description: Partially updates (PATCHes) an existing Google Calendar, modifying only the fields provided; `summary` is mandatory and cannot be an empty string, and an empty string for `description` or `location` clears them.

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: New title for the calendar; cannot be an empty string.

location.title: Location
location.description: New geographic location of the calendar (e.g., 'Paris, France').

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: New IANA Time Zone Database name for the calendar (e.g., 'Europe/Zurich', 'America/New_York').

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to update; use 'primary' for the main calendar or a specific ID.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_PATCH_EVENT
tools.description: Update specified fields of an existing event in a Google Calendar using patch semantics (array fields like `attendees` are fully replaced if provided); ensure the `calendar_id` and `event_id` are valid and the user has write access to the calendar.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: New end time (RFC3339 timestamp, e.g., '2024-07-01T11:00:00-07:00'). Uses `timezone` if provided, otherwise UTC. For all-day events, use YYYY-MM-DD format (exclusive end date).

event_id.title: Event Id
event_id.description: Identifier of the event to update. Must be provided in snake_case format.

location.title: Location
location.description: New geographic location (physical address or virtual meeting link).

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: IANA Time Zone Database name for start/end times (e.g., 'America/Los_Angeles'). Used if `start_time` and `end_time` are provided and not all-day dates; defaults to UTC if unset.

attendees.title: Attendees
attendees.description: List of email addresses for attendees. Replaces existing attendees. Provide an empty list to remove all.

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: New start time (RFC3339 timestamp, e.g., '2024-07-01T10:00:00-07:00'). Uses `timezone` if provided, otherwise UTC. For all-day events, use YYYY-MM-DD format.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Identifier of the calendar. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the logged-in user. To find other calendar IDs, use the `calendarList.list` method. Must be provided in snake_case format.

description.title: Description
examples: Weekly team sync meeting to discuss project updates.
description.description: New description for the event; can include HTML.

send_updates.title: Send Updates
send_updates.description: Whether to send update notifications to attendees: 'all', 'externalOnly', or 'none'. Uses default user behavior if unspecified.

max_attendees.title: Max Attendees
max_attendees.description: Maximum attendees in response; does not affect invited count. If more, response includes organizer only. Must be positive.

rsvp_response.title: Rsvp Response
rsvp_response.description: RSVP response status for the authenticated user. Updates only the current user's response status without affecting other attendees. Possible values: 'needsAction', 'declined', 'tentative', 'accepted'.

supports_attachments.title: Supports Attachments
supports_attachments.description: Client application supports event attachments. Set to `True` if so.

conference_data_version.title: Conference Data Version
conference_data_version.description: API client's conference data support version. Set to 1 to manage conference details (e.g., Google Meet links); 0 (default) ignores conference data.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_PATCH_LABEL
tools.description: Patches the specified label.

id.title: Id
id.description: The ID of the label to update.

name.title: Name
name.description: The display name of the label.

color.title: PatchLabelColor

textColor.title: Text Color
textColor.description: The text color of the label, represented as a hex string. Must be one of Gmail's predefined colors from the color palette. See: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides/labels#color_palette

backgroundColor.title: Background Color
backgroundColor.description: The background color of the label, represented as a hex string. Must be one of Gmail's predefined colors from the color palette. See: https://developers.google.com/workspace/gmail/api/guides/labels#color_palette

color.description: The color to assign to the label. Color is only available for labels that have their `type` set to `user`.

userId.title: User Id
userId.description: The user's email address. The special value `me` can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

labelListVisibility.title: Label List Visibility
labelListVisibility.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

messageListVisibility.title: Message List Visibility
messageListVisibility.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_PATCH_TASK
tools.description: Partially updates an existing task (identified by `task_id`) within a specific Google Task list (identified by `tasklist_id`), modifying only the provided attributes from `TaskInput` (e.g., `title`, `notes`, `due` date, `status`) and requiring both the task and list to exist.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for the task. Generated by Google Tasks API when creating a task. Used for updating or deleting existing tasks.

due.title: Due
due.description:
Due date for the task (optional). NOTE: Google Tasks only stores the date portion - any time provided will be normalized to midnight UTC by the API. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

etag.title: Etag
etag.description: ETag of the resource for concurrency control. Prevents accidental overwrites when multiple clients modify the same task. Auto-generated by the API.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Additional details or description for the task. Supports plain text only (no HTML/markdown). Maximum 8192 characters. Example: 'Include Q3 sales data and projections'

title.title: Title
title.description: Title/name of the task (REQUIRED). This is the main text displayed for the task. Maximum 1024 characters. Example: 'Complete quarterly report'

hidden.title: Hidden
hidden.description: Whether the task is hidden from the default view. Hidden tasks can still be accessed via API but won't show in UI. Default: false

status.title: Status
status.description: Current status of the task (REQUIRED). Must be either 'needsAction' (task is pending) or 'completed' (task is done). Default: 'needsAction'

deleted.title: Deleted
deleted.description: Whether the task has been deleted. Deleted tasks are marked but not immediately removed, allowing for recovery. Default: false

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: Identifier of the Google Task to be updated within the specified task list.

completed.title: Completed
completed.description:
Date/time when the task was marked as completed. Only applicable when status='completed'. Unlike 'due', this field preserves the time component. 
Google Tasks API requires dates in RFC3339 format (e.g., 2025-09-22T13:48:27Z).
We automatically convert various human-readable formats to RFC3339:

Accepted formats:
• 2025-09-28T23:59:00Z → RFC3339/ISO-8601 format (preferred) - September 28, 2025 at 11:59 PM UTC
• 28 Sep 2025 → Simple date format - Will be converted to midnight UTC on that date
• 11:59 PM, 22 Sep 2025 → Time with date - Assumes UTC timezone if not specified
• 1:00 PM, 21 Sep 2025 → 12-hour format with date - Converted to 13:00 UTC
• UTC-5:30, 6:50 PM → With timezone offset - Converted to UTC automatically
• UTC+1, 11:59 PM, 31 Dec → Timezone with date - Next occurrence of Dec 31
• 2025-09-21T15:30:00+02:00 → RFC3339 with timezone offset

Note: If no timezone is specified, UTC is assumed. Dates without times default to midnight UTC.

tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id
tasklist_id.description: Identifier of the Google Task list that contains the task to be updated.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_PATCH_TASK_LIST
tools.description: Updates the title of an existing Google Tasks task list.

tasklist_id.title: Tasklist Id
tasklist_id.description: The unique identifier of the task list to be updated.

updated_title.title: Updated Title
updated_title.description: The new title for the task list.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_QUERY_AUDIENCE_EXPORT
tools.description: Tool to query a completed audience export. Use when you need to fetch user rows with pagination.

inputSchema.title: QueryAudienceExportRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. Resource name of the audience export. Format: properties/{property}/audienceExports/{audienceExport}.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Optional. Number of rows to return. Must be between 1 and 250000. Defaults to 10000.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Optional. Zero-based start row index for pagination. Defaults to 0.

inputSchema.description: Request model for querying an existing Google Analytics audience export.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_QUERY_AUDIENCE_LIST
tools.description: Tool to query an audience list. Use when you need to retrieve user rows from a GA4 audience list with pagination.

inputSchema.title: QueryAudienceListRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Required. Audience list resource to query. Format: properties/{property}/audienceLists/{audienceList}.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Optional. Number of rows to return; default 10,000; maximum 250,000.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Optional. Zero-based row offset for pagination.

inputSchema.description: Request model for querying a Google Analytics audience list.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_QUERY_TABLE
tools.description: This action is used to query a table in a Google Spreadsheet, call this action to query a table in a spreadsheet. Execute SQL-like SELECT queries against spreadsheet tables. Supports WHERE conditions, ORDER BY, LIMIT clauses. Call this action after calling the GET_TABLE_SCHEMA action to query a table in a spreadsheet.

sql.title: Sql
examples: SELECT project, totals FROM "Sales_Data" WHERE totals > 10.0 ORDER BY totals DESC
SELECT name, email FROM "Customers" WHERE status = 'ACTIVE'
sql.description: SQL SELECT query. Supported: SELECT cols FROM table WHERE conditions ORDER BY col LIMIT n. Table names must be quoted if they contain spaces.

spreadsheet_id.title: Spreadsheet Id
spreadsheet_id.description: Google Sheets ID

include_formulas.title: Include Formulas
include_formulas.description: Whether to return formula text instead of calculated values for formula columns

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_QUICK_ADD
tools.description: Parses natural language text to quickly create a basic Google Calendar event with its title, date, and time, suitable for simple scheduling; does not support direct attendee addition or recurring events, and `calendar_id` must be valid if not 'primary'.

text.title: Text
examples: Dentist appointment tomorrow at 2pm for 45 minutes
text.description: Natural language input describing the event; Google Calendar parses this for event details like title, date, and time.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Identifier of the calendar for the event. Use 'primary' for the main calendar, or provide a specific calendar ID (e.g., email address).

send_updates.title: Send Updates
send_updates.description: Controls whether email notifications about the event creation are sent to attendees.

tools.name: GOOGLESUPER_REMOVE_ATTENDEE
tools.description: Removes an attendee from a specified event in a Google Calendar; the calendar and event must exist.

calendar_id.title: Calendar Id
calendar_id.description: Identifier of the Google Calendar to which the event belongs; 'primary' signifies the user's main calendar.

attendee_email.title: Attendee Email
attendee_email.description: Email address of the attendee to remove. Must match an attendee email present on the event.
